URL: http://www.laokaoya.com/26351.html
内容:
剑桥雅思10Test1Section1听力原文与答案 self-drive tours in the USA
剑桥雅思10听力第一套题目第一部分的主题为美国自驾游咨询，可以归于旅游场景中。考察的内容包括顾客信息，听到公司的途径，各种景点，以及两条线路的具体介绍。整体来说不算太难，考察的知识点也不是很生僻。
点击查看这篇雅思听力中需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
与具体题目的
答案解析
：
雅思备考听力篇 剑10 test 1 section 1 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思10Test1听力Section1答案解析 self-drive tours in the USA
剑桥雅思10
test 1 Section 1
雅思听力
原文
TRAVEL AGENT
: Good morning.World Tours.
My name is Jamie. How can I help you?
ANDREA
: Good morning. I want some information on self-drive tours in the USA.
Could you send me a brochure?
TRAVEL AGENT
: Of course. Could I have your name please?
ANDREA
: Andrea Brown.
TRAVEL AGENT
: Thank you. And your address?
ANDREA
: 24,
Ardleigh (Q1)
Road.
TRAVEL AGENT
: Can you spell that?
ANDREA
: A-R-D-L-E-l-G-H Road.
TRAVEL AGENT
: Postcode?
ANDREA
: BH5 2OP.
TRAVEL AGENT
: Thanks. And can I have your phone number?
ANDREA
: Is a mobile alright?
TRAVEL AGENT
: Fine.
ANDREA
: It’s 07786643091.
TRAVEL AGENT
: Thank you. And can I ask you where you heard about World Tours?
From a friend? Or did you see an advert somewhere?
ANDREA
: No, I read about you in the
newspaper (Q2)
.
TRAVEL AGENT
: OK, I’ll get the brochures in the post to you but can I give you some information over the phone.
What kinds of things do you want to do on your holiday?
ANDREA
: I’m interested in going to California with my family.
I’ve got two children and we want to hire a car.
TRAVEL AGENT
: OK.
We have a couple of self-drive tours there visiting different places of interest in California.
The first one begins in Los Angeles and there’s plenty of time to visit some of the
theme
(Q3)
parks there.
ANDREA
: That’s something on my children’s list so I’d want to include that.
TRAVEL AGENT
: Good.
Then you drive to San Francisco.
From San Francisco you can drive to Yosemite Park where you spend a couple of nights.
You can choose to stay in a lodge or on the
campsite
.
ANDREA
: I don’t like the idea of staying in a
tent (Q4)
.
It’d be too hot.
TRAVEL AGENT
: Right. And the tour ends in Las Vegas.
ANDREA
: OK.
TRAVEL AGENT
: The other trip we can arrange is slightly different.
It starts in San Francisco.
Then you drive south to Cambria.
ANDREA
: Someone told me there’s a really nice
castle (Q5)
near Cambria.
Will we go near that?
TRAVEL AGENT
: Hearst Castle is on that road so you could stop there.
ANDREA
: Good. I’d like to do that.
Does this trip also go into the desert?
TRAVEL AGENT
: No, it continues to Santa Monica where most people like to stop and do some shopping.
ANDREA
: We have enough of that at home so that doesn’t interest us.
TRAVEL AGENT
: OK. Well, you could go straight on to San Diego.
ANDREA
: That’s good for
beaches (Q6)
isn’t it?
TRAVEL AGENT
: That’s right, that’s a good place to relax and your children might like to visit the zoo before flying home.
ANDREA
: I don’t think so.
We want some time for sunbathing and swimming.
ANDREA
: So how many days are the trips and how much do they cost?
TRAVEL AGENT
: The first one I told you about is a self-drive tour through California which lasts twelve days and covers
2020 (Q7)
kilometres.
The shortest journey is 206 km and the longest is 632 kilometres.
The cost is £525 per person.
That includes
accommodation
, car rental and a
flight (Q8)
but no meals.
ANDREA
: OK. And the other trip?
TRAVEL AGENT
: That lasts nine days but you spend only three days on the road.
You cover about 980 kilometres
altogether
.
ANDREA
: So is that cheaper then?
TRAVEL AGENT
: Yes, it’s almost a hundred pounds cheaper.
It’s £
429 (Q9)
per person, which is a good deal.
ANDREA
: So that covers
accommodation
and car hire.
What about flights?
TRAVEL AGENT
: They aren’t included.
But these hotels offer
dinner (Q10)
in the price.
ANDREA
: OK. Well, thank you very much.
I’ll be in touch when I’ve had a chance to look at the brochure.
TRAVEL AGENT
: I’m pleased to help. Goodbye.
ANDREA
: Bye.
剑桥雅思10 Test1 Section1雅思听力答案
1. Ardleigh
2. newspaper
3. theme
4. tent
5. castle
6. beach/beaches
7. 2020
8. flight
9. 429
10. dinner

URL: http://www.laokaoya.com/30275.html
内容:
剑桥雅思10Test1听力Section1答案解析 self-drive tours in the USA
剑桥雅思10听力第一套题目第一部分由6道笔记填空题和4道表格填空题构成。考察内容包括字母拼写，数字，以及旅游场景中常见的一些景点。下面是具体每道题目的答案解析。
点击查看这篇
雅思听力
对应的
录音原文
与需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思10Test1Section1听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑10 test 1 section 1 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思10 Test1 Section1听力答案解析
第1题答案：Ardleigh
对应原文：A-R-D-L-E-l-G-H Road.
答案解析：考察字母拼写，本身没有什么难度，基本属于送分题。
第2题答案：newspaper
对应原文：No, I read about you in the
newspaper
答案解析：简单的他人更正，旅行机构先给出一些建议，Andrea否定之后再给出正确答案。不过需要注意的是，目前也有不少题目是提问者给出建议之后，回答者直接答应的。也就是说不会再提到正确答案。所以哪怕是问题里的内容，大家也需要注意一下。
第3题答案：theme
对应原文：The first one begins in Los Angeles and there’s plenty of time to visit some of the
theme
parks there.
答案解析：雅思听力中，问到什么park时，答案一般就两种，一种是theme park，一种是entertainment park。
第4题答案：tent
对应原文：
I don’t like the idea of staying in a
tent
.
It’d be too hot.
答案解析：一些同学可能会把前文中的campsite当作答案。虽然从含义上讲也没错，但雅思听力Section1中一般以回答者说的内容为准。
第5题答案：castle
对应原文：Someone told me there’s a really nice
castle
near Cambria
答案解析：castle也是雅思听力前两部分旅游场景中十分常见的景点之一。由于单词中间的t不发音，所以需要大家多加注意一下拼写。
第6题答案：beach/beaches
对应原文：That’s good for
beaches
答案解析：这道题的迷惑性有点强。主要在于Andrea后面又说了sunbathing和swimming，不少同学会把后面的swimming当作答案写下来。这里老烤鸭小编要提醒大家的是，除非题干上给出明确的并列关系，要不然雅思听力中，并列的单词一般都不会作为答案出现。
第7题答案：2020
对应原文：The first one I told you about is a self-drive tour through California which lasts twelve days and covers
2020
kilometres
答案解析：直接考察数字，没有什么花里胡哨的地方。不过录音在说完答案之后，又说了206和632。但哪怕大家没有听清楚，它们也明显不符合表头total distance这一要求，可以轻松排除。
第8题答案：flight
对应原文：
The cost is £525 per person.
That includes
accommodation
, car rental and a
flight
but no meals.
答案解析：部分同学可能会写成flat。如果是这样的话，需要加强一下自己的听音辨音能力。此外，flat与第一条accommodation属于从属关系，没办法并列，也可以根据这一点排除。
第9题答案：429
对应原文：
it’s almost a hundred pounds cheaper.
It’s £
429
per person, which is a good deal.
答案解析：还是考察数字，没有什么特别的地方。
第10题答案：dinner
对应原文：
They aren’t included.
But these hotels offer
dinner
in the price.
答案解析：一般旅游咨询场景中都会问到食物的问题。要么是食物是否包含在价格里面，要么是饮食有什么需要注意的地方（很多情况下，答案都是vegetarian）。

URL: http://www.laokaoya.com/26436.html
内容:
剑桥雅思10Test1Section2听力原文与答案 Joining the leisure club
剑桥雅思10听力第一套题目第二部分的主题为健身俱乐部开业介绍，内容包括健身俱乐部的设施，一开始 身体评测，以及各种会员类型和相应的服务。后面的填空题难度相对较大。
点击查看这篇雅思听力中需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
与具体题目的
答案解析
：
雅思备考听力篇 剑10 test 1 section 2 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思10Test1听力Section2答案解析 New city developments
剑桥雅思10
test1 Section２
雅思听力
原文
On behalf of LP Clubs, I’d like to welcome you all here today.
My name’s Sandy Fisher and I’m one of the fitness managers here.
Before we start our tour of the club I’ll just run through some basic information about the facilities we
have here, including recent improvements, and explain the types of membership available.
Our greatest asset is probably
our swimming pool which at 25 metres isn’t Olympic-sized, but
now we’ve expanded it to eight lanes, it’s much wider (Q11)
.
This means there are rarely more than a couple of people at a time in each lane.
Unfortunately, there isn’t space for an outdoor pool here but the glass roof on the swimming pool is
partly
retractable
, which means you can enjoy something of the open-air experience on warmer days.
Our recently refurbished fitness
suite (Q12)
has all the latest exercise equipment including ten new
running machines and a wide range of weight-training machines. 
Each member is given full training in how to operate the equipment and there is always a trainer on duty
to offer help and advice.
Although we do have adult-only times after 6 and at certain times at weekends, children are well catered
for.
Older children continue to benefit from a wide range of tuition; anything from trampolining to yoga.
One thing all our members appreciate about us is that we take very good care of them.
This starts on day one with your personal
assessment
.
You are asked to fill in a
questionnaire
giving details of any
health
problems
(Q13)
.
One of our personal trainers will then go through this with you.
The trainer will then take you through the
safety rules (Q14)
for using the equipment in the fitness
suite
.
During your next exercise session a personal trainer will work with you to make sure you understand
these.
It’s very important to do this because we really do want to avoid having any sports injuries.
There’s a lot more to looking after yourself than simply lifting weights!
At the end of the personal
assessment
, the trainer will draw up a
plan (Q15)
, outlining what you should try to
achieve within a six-week period.
This will then be reviewed at the end of the six weeks.
Now, I’ll just quickly run through the types of membership we have available.
All members must pay a
joining (Q16)
fee of £90 in addition to the rates for the monthly membership fees.
Gold membership entitles you to
free entry
(Q17)
at all LP Clubs.
There are now LP clubs in all major cities and towns so if you travel a lot this will be a great advantage.
Individual gold membership costs £50 a month and joint membership for you and your partner will cost
£75.
Premier membership is for professional people whose work commitments make it difficult for them to
use the club during the day and so LP gives booking preferences to Premier members at
peak
(Q18)
times.
This means you will find it easier to book the sessions at times that suit you.
Reciprocal
arrangements with other LP Clubs are available to Premier members.
Premier membership is for individuals only, but you will be sent passes for
guests
(Q19)
every month.
The monthly fee is £65.
You don’t have to have any special clothes or equipment when you visit the club.
We provide robes and hairdryers in the changing rooms, but it’s very important to remember your
photo
card
(Q20)
because you won’t be able to get in without it.
For people who aren’t working during the day then…
剑桥雅思10 Test1 Section1雅思听力答案
11. A
12. C
13. health problems
14. safety rules
15. plan
16. joining
17. free entry
18. peak
19. guests
20. photo card/photo cards

URL: http://www.laokaoya.com/30320.html
内容:
剑桥雅思10Test1听力Section2答案解析 New city developments
剑桥雅思10听力第一套题目第二部分由1道5选2的多选和8道单句填空组成。难度上还算是与目前雅思听力考试的Section2比较相符。不过填空在最近的Section2中出现的比较少，大家需要稍微注意一下。
点击查看这篇
雅思听力
对应的
录音原文
与需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思10Test1Section2听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑10 test 1 section 2 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思10 Test1 Section2听力答案解析
第11题答案：A
对应原文：
Our recently refurbished fitness
suite
has all the latest exercise equipment including ten new
running machines and a wide range of weight-training machines.
答案解析：录音中提到，健身房最近进行了装修，增加了跑步机和一系列的举铁设备。选项A中gym与fitness suite同义替换，refurbished对应题干中的improved，由此确定答案。
第12题答案：C
对应原文：
Our greatest asset is probably
our swimming pool which at 25 metres isn’t Olympic-sized, but
now we’ve expanded it to eight lanes, it’s much wider
… Unfortunately, there isn’t space for an outdoor pool
答案解析：相信绝大多数同学都能听出来泳池进行了更新，但往往会困惑于到底是室内的泳池文章来自老烤鸭雅思还是室外的。如果根据后面的内容猜测不出来是indoor的话，可以根据unfortunately排除outdoor，进而确认C为正确答案。
第13题答案：health problems
对应原文：You are asked to fill in a
questionnaire
giving details of any
health
problems
答案解析：听到小标题personal assessment意识到答案即将到来。不过这道题里的空前提示词没有任何用处，只能根据词性和重读来判断答案。
第14题答案：safety rules
对应原文：The trainer will then take you through the
safety rules
for using the equipment in the fitness
suite
.
答案解析：不少同学会将trainer当成答案写上去，但题干中说的是be explained，而非explain，因此确定safety rules才是正确答案。
第15题答案：plan
对应原文：
At the end of the personal
assessment
, the trainer will draw up a
plan
, outlining what you should try to
achieve within a six-week period
答案解析：一部分同学可能会根据修饰关系将period当成答案，但它不具备任何实在含义。而听力中不具备具体含义的词往往是不能做答案的，因此排除period。根据句义锁定plan。
第16题答案：joining
对应原文：All members must pay a
joining
fee of £90 in addition to the rates for the monthly membership fees
答案解析：在雅思听力中，健身房的费用往往分为三种：joining fee, monthly fee, 以及course/class fee，大家可以积累一下。
第17题答案：free entry
对应原文：Gold membership entitles you to
free entry
at all LP Clubs
答案解析：听到gold members意识到答案即将出现，be given与entitle同义替换，由此确定free entry（免费进入）为答案。
第18题答案：peak
对应原文：
Premier membership is for professional people whose work commitments make it difficult for them to
use the club during the day and so LP gives booking preferences to Premier members at
peak
times.
答案解析：虽然premier membership可以提示我们答案即将到来，但因为它离peak太远，十分考验我们的耐心。不过只要慢慢等下去，就很容易根据hours与times的同义替换确定peak为答案。
第19题答案：guests
对应原文：Premier membership is for individuals only, but you will be sent passes for
guests
every month.
答案解析：虽然我们在录音中找不到bring some的同义替换，但空后every month说的很明显，可以根据这一点，通过短期回忆确定guests为答案。
第20题答案：photo card/photo cards
对应原文：
We provide robes and hairdryers in the changing rooms, but it’s very important to remember your
photo
card
because you won’t be able to get in without it.
答案解析：这道题同样没有明显的提示词，只能根据词性和句义来对听到的词汇进行筛选。不过好在photo card读的还是比较重的，而且拼写也不难。

URL: http://www.laokaoya.com/26555.html
内容:
剑桥雅思10Test1Section3听力原文与答案 Global Design Competition
剑桥雅思10听力第一套题目第三部分的主题为老师辅导学生参加全球设计大赛，内容包括比赛的要求，选择洗碗机的原因，具体的设计特点，遇到的困难与解决方案等。
点击查看这篇雅思听力中需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
与具体题目的
答案解析
：
雅思备考听力篇 剑10 test 1 section 3 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思10Test1听力Section3答案解析 Global Design Competition
剑桥雅思10
test1 Section3
雅思听力
原文
JOHN: Erm… hello Professor, I’m John Wishart.
I’m working on my entry for the Global Design Competition.
My tutor said you might be able to help me with it.
PROFESSOR: Ah, yes. I got a copy of your drawings.
Come in and tell me about it.
What sort of competition is it?
JOHN: Well, It’s an international design competition and we have to come up with a new design for a typical domestic kitchen appliance.
PROFESSOR: I see, and are there any special conditions?
Does it have to save energy for example?
JOHN: Actually that was the focus in last year’s competition.
This year’s different.
We have to adopt an
innovative
approach to existing technology (Q21)
, using it in a way that hasn’t been thought of before.
PROFESSOR: I see, that sounds tricky.
And what kitchen appliance have you chosen?
JOHN: Well, I decided to choose the dishwasher.
PROFESSOR: Interesting, what made you choose that?
JOHN: Well, they’re an everyday kitchen appliance in most Australian houses but they’re all pretty boring and almost
identical
to each other.
I think some people will be prepared to pay a little extra for something that looks different (Q22)
.
PROFESSOR: That’s a nice idea.
I see you’ve called your design ‘the Rockpool’; why is that?
JOHN: Basically because it looks like the rock pools you find on a beach.
The top is made of glass so that you can look down into it.
PROFESSOR: And there’s a stone at the bottom.
Is that just for decoration?
JOHN: Actually it does have a function.
Instead of pushing a button, you turn the stone (Q23)
.
PROFESSOR: So it’s really just a novel way of starting the dishwasher.
JOHN: That’s right.
PROFESSOR: It’s a really nice design, but what makes it
innovative
?
JOHN: Well, I decided to make a dishwasher that uses
carbon
dioxide
.
PROFESSOR: In place of water and
detergent
?
How will you manage that?
JOHN: The idea is to pressurise the
carbon
dioxide
so that it becomes a liquid.
The
fluid
is then released into the dishwasher where it cleans the dishes all by itself.
PROFESSOR: Sounds like a brilliant idea!
Your system will totally do away with the need for strong detergents.
So what happens once the dishes are clean?
JOHN: Well, to allow them to dry, the liquid
carbon
dioxide
and the waste materials all go to an area called the holding
chamber
.
That’s where the liquid is depressurised and so it reverts to a gas (Q24)
.
Then the oil and
grease
are separated out and sent to the waste system.
PROFESSOR: It sounds like you’ve thought it all out very thoroughly.
So, what happens to the
carbon
dioxide
once the process is complete?
Not wasted I hope.
JOHN: Actually, that’s where the real savings are made.
The
carbon
dioxide
is sent back to the cylinder and can be used again and again (Q25)
.
PROFESSOR: What a terrific idea.
Do you think it will ever be built?
JOHN: Probably not, but that’s OK.
PROFESSOR: Well, I’m sure a lot of positive things will come out of your design.
PROFESSOR: Now, you seem to have thought about everything so what exactly did you need me to help you with?
JOHN: Well, my design has made it to the final stage of the competition and, in a few months’ time, I have to give a
presentation
(Q26)
, and that’s the part I was hoping you could help me with.
PROFESSOR: Right, well that should be easy enough.
What have you managed to do so far?
JOHN: Well, I’ve got detailed drawings to show how it will work and I’ve also written a 500-word paper on it.
PROFESSOR: I see. Well, if you want to stand a good chance of winning you really need a
model (Q27)
of the machine.
JOHN: Yes, I thought I might but I’m having a few problems.
PROFESSOR: What is the main difficulty so far?
Let me guess—is it the
materials (Q28)
?
JOHN: Yes, I want it to look professional but everything that’s top quality is also very expensive.
PROFESSOR: Look, projects like this are very important to us.
They really help lift our profile.
So why don’t you talk to the university about a
grant (Q29)
?
I can help you fill out the application forms if you like.
JOHN: That would be great.
PROFESSOR: You’d better show me this paper you’ve written as well.
For a global competition such as this you need to make sure the
technical
(Q30)
details you’ve given are accurate and thorough.
JOHN: That would be a great help.
PROFESSOR: Is there anything else I can do?
JOHN: Well, I’m really…
剑桥雅思10 Test1 Section3雅思听力答案
21. C
22. A
23. B
24. A
25. C
26. presentation
27. model
28. material/materials
29. grant
30. technical

URL: http://www.laokaoya.com/30431.html
内容:
剑桥雅思10Test1听力Section3答案解析 Global Design Competition
剑桥雅思10听力第一套题目第三部分由5道单项选择和5道笔记填空组成。其中，单选的难度不算太大，甚至更加贴近Section2一些。但后面填空的难度陡然增加，一不小心就会错过答案。不过这也算是Section3填空题的常见特点。下面是具体每道题目的答案解析。

对应的
录音原文
与其中出现的需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思10Test1Section3听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑10 test 1 section 3 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思10 Test1 Section3听力答案解析
第21题答案：C
对应原文：
This year’s different.
We have to adopt an
innovative
approach to existing technology
, using it in a way that hasn’t been thought of before
答案解析：C选项用develop替换adopt，new替换innovative，use替换approach，current替换exsiting，technology原词出现，由此确定答案。A选项和B选项都是去年的主题，因此排除。
第22题答案：A
对应原文：
they’re an everyday kitchen appliance in most Australian houses but they’re all pretty boring and almost
identical
to each other.
I think some people will be prepared to pay a little extra for something that looks different
答案解析：这道题的难点在于appealing的含义，如果大家知道它是“有吸引力的，令人感兴趣的”的意思，那么很容易在looks different与appealing之间建立联系，由此确定A选项为正确答案。但如果不认识这个单词的话，可能这道题就要看运气了。
第23题答案：B
对应原文：
Actually it does have a function.
Instead of pushing a button, you turn the stone
答案解析：这道题采用Section3比较常见的他人更正的手法。女性先提出A选项作为猜想，随后男性进行否定，说出B为答案。
第24题答案：A
对应原文：
to allow them to dry, the liquid
carbon
dioxide
and the waste materials all go to an area called the holding
chamber
.
That’s where the liquid is depressurised and so it reverts to a gas
答案解析：这道题的关键在于题干上holding chamber这一限定条件。只要能耐心等到录音中说到这个单词，就可以很轻易的选出A为正确答案。
第25题答案：C
对应原文：
that’s where the real savings are made.
The
carbon
dioxide
is sent back to the cylinder and can be used again and again
答案解析：这道题比较简单，考察re-used与be used again and again的同义替换。哪怕没有听到，也可以根据常识确定C为答案。毕竟A和B都有污染环境的嫌疑。
第26题答案：presentation
对应原文： my design has made it to the final stage of the competition and, in a few months’ time, I have to give a
presentation
, and that’s the part I was hoping you could help me with.
答案解析：这道题采用语序颠倒的手法，先说答案presentation，再说提示词help，比较考验大家的短期记忆能力。
第27题答案：model
对应原文：Well, if you want to stand a good chance of winning you really need a
model
of the machine
答案解析：这道题考察所有格结构。可以根据of确定答案为model。不过因为录音中没有出现任何题干上的原词，model读的有很轻，不太好识别。
第28题答案：material/materials
对应原文：
PROFESSOR: What is the main difficulty so far?
Let me guess—is it the
materials
?
JOHN: Yes, I want it to look professional but everything that’s top quality is also very expensive.
答案解析：老师先提出建议，然后男性给予肯定，算是他人更正的一种变形。出题人希望利用大家的惯性思维，认为答案出现在后面，直接忽略老师的提议，进而错过答案单词。
第29题答案：grant
对应原文：
They really help lift our profile.
So why don’t you talk to the university about a
grant
?
I can help you fill out the application forms if you like.
答案解析：同样是语序颠倒的手法，将提示词apply的对应内容放在了答案后面。再加上一些同学不太熟悉grant这一单词，很容易错过。
第30题答案：technical
对应原文：For a global competition such as this you need to make sure the
technical
details you’ve given are accurate and thorough.
答案解析：考察information与details的同义替换。它们也算是雅思听力中比较固定的一组单词，大家可以积累一下。

内容:
剑桥雅思10Test1Section4听力原文与答案 The Spirit Bear
剑桥雅思10听力第一套题目第四部分介绍了某种白色的熊。内容包括其颜色来源，当地人对它们的态度，栖息地的状况，目前所面临的威胁，以及未来可能的发展方向等。
点击查看这篇雅思听力中需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
与具体题目的
答案解析
：
雅思备考听力篇 剑10 test 1 section 4 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思10Test1听力Section4答案解析 The Spirit Bear
剑桥雅思10
test1 Section4
雅思听力
原文
Today we continue our series on ecology and conservation with a look at a particularly endangered member of the black bear family.
One in ten black bears is actually born with a white coat, which is the result of a special
gene (Q1)
that surfaces in a few.
Local people have named it ‘the spirit bear’.
And according to the legends of these communities, its snowy
fur
brings with it a special
power (Q2)
.
Because of this, it has always been highly regarded by them—so much that they do not speak of seeing it to anyone else.
It is their way of protecting it when
strangers (Q3)
visit the area.
The white bear’s habitat is quite interesting.
The bear’s strong relationship with the old-growth rainforest is a complex one.
The while bear relies on the huge centuries-old trees in the forest in many ways.
For example, the old-growth trees have extremely long roots that help prevent
erosion
(Q4)
of the soil along the banks of the many fish streams.
Keeping these banks
intact
is important because these streams are home to
salmon
, which are the bear’s main food source.
In return, the bear s feeding habits
nurture
the forest.
As the bears eat the
salmon
, they
discard
the skin and bones in great amounts on the forest floor, which provide vital nutrients.
These produce
lush
vegetation
that sustains thousands of other types of life forms, from birds to insects and more.
Today, the spirit bear lives off the coast of the province of British Columbia on a few
islands (Q5)
.
There is great concern for their survival since it is estimated that less than two hundred of these white bears remain.
The best way to protect them is to make every effort to
preserve
the delicate balance of their forest environment—in other words, their
ecosystem
.
The greatest threat to the bear’s existence is the loss of its habitat.
Over many years, logging companies have stripped the land by cutting down a large number of trees.
In addition, they have built
roads (Q6)
which have fractured the areas where the bear usually feeds, and many
hibernation
sites have also been lost.
The logging of the trees along the streams has damaged the places where the bears fish.
To make matters worse, the number of
salmon
in those streams is declining because there is no legal limit on
fishing (Q7)
at the moment.
All these influences have a negative impact on the spirit bear’s very existence, which is made all the more
fragile
by the fact that
reproduction
(Q8)
among these bears has always been disappointingly low.
And so, what’s the situation going forward?
Community organizations, environmental groups and the British Columbia government are now working together on the problem.
The government is now requiring logging companies to adopt a better logging
method (Q9)
, which is a positive step.
However, these measures alone may not be
sufficient
to ensure a healthy population of the spirit bear in the future.
Other steps also need to be taken.
While it is important to maintain the spirit bear’s habitat, there also needs to be more emphasis on its
expansion (Q10)
.
The move is justified as it will also create space for other bears that are losing their homes.

32. power/powers
33. strangers
34. erosion
35. islands
36. roads
37. fishing
38. reproduction
39. method/methods
40. expansion

内容:
剑桥雅思10Test1听力Section4答案解析 The Spirit Bear
剑桥雅思10听力第一套题目第四部分由10道提纲型填空组成。形式上与现在考试Section4的主流题型十分相近。虽然稍微有些简单，但仍不失为十分优秀的练习材料。下面是具体每道题目的答案解析。
点击查看这篇
雅思听力
对应的
录音原文
与其中出现的需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思10Test1Section4听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑10 test 1 section 4 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思10 Test1 Section4听力答案解析
第31题答案：gene
对应原文：
One in ten black bears is actually born with a white coat, which is the result of a special
gene
that surfaces in a few.
答案解析：听到black bear意识到答案即将到来，special与uncommon同义替换，由此确定答案为gene。
第32题答案：power/powers
对应原文：And according to the legends of these communities, its snowy
fur
brings with it a special
power
答案解析：题干中的单词在录音中并没有原词出现。不过我们可以根据and，以及语气的起伏来判断内容的切换，在利用unusual与special的同义替换锁定power。
第33题答案：strangers
对应原文：
Because of this, it has always been highly regarded by them—so much that they do not speak of seeing it to anyone else.
It is their way of protecting it when
strangers
visit the area.
答案解析：听到protect意识到答案即将出现。虽然空前词from没有任何对应点，但strangers读的很重，而且文章来自老烤鸭雅思是这句话中唯一填进去之后语义合适的名词，由此确定答案。
第34题答案：erosion
对应原文：For example, the old-growth trees have extremely long roots that help prevent
erosion
of the soil along the banks of the many fish streams
答案解析：prevent与stop的同义替换很好识别，这道题的难点主要在于答案的拼写。而且录音中还有少许变音，erosion读的是/əˈrəʊʒn/，而非/ɪˈrəʊʒn/。
第35题答案：islands
对应原文：Today, the spirit bear lives off the coast of the province of British Columbia on a few
islands
答案解析：这道题与上一题之间夹杂了很多废话，比较考验大家的耐心。不过我们可以根据上一行结尾处的forest vegetation来判断答案即将出现。a small number of与a few同义替换，由此确定答案为islands。
第36题答案：roads
对应原文：
Over many years, logging companies have stripped the land by cutting down a large number of trees.
In addition, they have built
roads
答案解析：不少同学会将读的比较重的trees当成答案，但它对应的其实是题干上的deforestation，因此不能往空上写。built与construction同义替换，由此确定答案为roads。
第37题答案：fishing
对应原文：To make matters worse, the number of
salmon
in those streams is declining because there is no legal limit on
fishing
at the moment.
答案解析：这道题的难点在于题干上没有明确的提示词来告诉我们答案即将到来。不过to make matters worse这一起连接作用的短语有一定的提示功能，再加上limit和unrestricted的替换，确定答案为fishing也不算太难。
第38题答案：reproduction
对应原文：All these influences have a negative impact on the spirit bear’s very existence, which is made all the more
fragile
by the fact that
reproduction
among these bears has always been disappointingly low.
答案解析：这道题算是该部分最难的一道。一方面出现了语序颠倒，本来位于空前的low rate放到了答案之后。让我们只能根据词性和句义去寻找答案。另一方面，一些同学不太熟悉reproduction（繁殖）这一单词，哪怕听到也可能直接排除。
第39题答案：method/methods
对应原文：The government is now requiring logging companies to adopt a better logging
method
, which is a positive step
答案解析：几乎算是送分题。题干中的companies和logging都没有任何变化，答案也是我们十分熟悉的单词。
第40题答案：expansion
对应原文：
While it is important to maintain the spirit bear’s habitat, there also needs to be more emphasis on its
expansion
答案解析：考察并列的知识点。在雅思听力中，题干上并列的两个单词A and B，在录音中经常被转换为A+解释+连接词+B的形式，大家可以稍加注意一下。

剑桥雅思10Test2听力Section1答案解析 Transport Survey
剑桥雅思10
test2 Section1
雅思听力
原文
INTERVIEWER
: Excuse me.
LUISA
: Yes?
INTERVIEWER
: I wonder if you could spare a few minutes to do a survey on transport.
It won’t take long.
LUISA
: No, that’s fine.
INTERVIEWER
: Lovely. The survey is on behalf of the local council.
They’d like to know about what transport you use and any suggestions for improvement.
Can I start by asking you how you travelled to town today?
LUISA
: Sure.
I came on the bus.
INTERVIEWER
: Great.
Now can I get a few details about yourself?
LUISA
: OK.
INTERVIEWER
: What’s your name?
LUISA
: It’s Luisa…
INTERVIEWER
: Yes.
LUISA
:
Hardie (Q1)
.
INTERVIEWER
: Can you spell that, please?
LUISA
: Yes.
It’s H-A-R-D-l-E.
INTERVIEWER
: Great.
Thanks.
And can I have your address?
LUISA
: It’s
19 (Q2)
, White Stone Road.
INTERVIEWER
: Oh, right.
I know that area.
It’s Bradfield, isn’t it?
LUISA
: That’s right.
INTERVIEWER
: Is the postcode GT7?
LUISA
: It’s actually
G-T-8, 2-L-C (Q3)
.
INTERVIEWER
: Great.
And could I ask what your job is?
Are you a student?
LUISA
: I’ve actually just finished my training.
I’m a
hairdresser (Q4)
.
INTERVIEWER
: Oh, right.
And one more question in this section.
What is the reason for you coming into town today?
LUISA
: Actually it’s not for shopping today, which would be my normal reason, but to see the
dentist (Q5)
.
INTERVIEWER
: Right.
Thanks.
INTERVIEWER
: Now in this last section I’d like you to give us some ideas about the facilities and arrangements in the city for getting to and from work, er, any suggestions you have for improvements.
LUISA
: Well, something I’ve thought about for some time is that when I do walk and I’m doing a later shift, I think the
lighting (Q6)
should be better.
INTERVIEWER
: Yes, good point.
LUISA
: And of course.
I think it’s a real shame they’ve been cutting down on the number of footpaths.
They should have more of those.
Then people would walk more.
INTERVIEWER
: Yes, right.
LUISA
: And, I don’t think there are enough
trains (Q7)
.
That’s why I don’t use them—you have to wait so long.
INTERVIEWER
: Thanks.
And finally I’d like to ask your opinion on cycling.
As you may know, there’s a drive in the city to get more people to cycle to work.
LUISA
: Right.
INTERVIEWER
: But we realise that there are things which the council, but also employers, might do to help encourage workers to cycle to work.
LUISA
: Yep.
Well, I have thought about it and where I work there are no
safe (Q8)
places to leave your bikes.
INTERVIEWER
:OK.
LUISA
: And also.
I’d have to cycle uphill and on a hot day, I’d arrive at work pretty sweaty so I think I’d need a
shower (Q9)
somewhere at work.
INTERVIEWER
: Right.
LUISA
: And I suppose the last thing is that I wouldn’t be all that confident about cycling on such busy roads.
I think I’d like to see you offering
training (Q10)
for that, you know, I’d feel a lot better about starting if that was the case.
INTERVIEWER
: Well, that’s very helpful.
Thank you very much for your time.
LUISA
:No problem.
Bye.

内容:
剑桥雅思10Test2听力Section1答案解析 Transport Survey
剑桥雅思10听力第二套题目第一部分由10道填空题组成。考察内容包括姓名拼写，地址，邮编，职位以及一些场景单词。虽然其中设置了一些小障碍，但整体难度不算太大。
点击查看这篇
雅思听力
对应的
录音原文
与其中出现的需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思10Test2Section1听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑10 test 2 section 1 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思10 Test2 Section1听力答案解析
第1题答案：Hardie
对应原文：
Yes.
It’s H-A-R-D-l-E.
答案解析：考察字母拼写，没有什么难度，属于送分题。
第2题答案：19
对应原文：It’s
19
, White Stone Road.
答案解析：考察十几和几十的区分。无论是teen的重读，还是长音/i:/读的都很明显，没有太强的迷惑性。
第3题答案：GT8 2LC
对应原文：It’s actually
G-T-8, 2-L-C
答案解析：雅思听力中的邮编一般为6位或者7位。通常采用开头字母，结尾字母，中间数字的形式。即AA55BB或者AA555BB。
第4题答案：hairdresser
对应原文：
I’ve actually just finished my training.
I’m a
hairdresser
答案解析：采用Section1中比较常见的他人更正的手法。先由提问者给出student，然后再由回答者否定，进而给出正确答案。hairdresser这一单词对一些同学来说文章来自老烤鸭雅思可能比较陌生，需要积累一下。
第5题答案：dentist/dentist’s
对应原文：Actually it’s not for shopping today, which would be my normal reason, but to see the
dentist
答案解析：采用自我更正的手法。先提出shopping并否定，随后再给出正确答案dentist。
第6题答案：lighting
对应原文：something I’ve thought about for some time is that when I do walk and I’m doing a later shift, I think the
lighting
should be better.
答案解析：lighting可能偶尔会出现浊化的现象。尾音/t/发出/d/的读音。此外，大家还要注意区分lighting（照明）和lightning（闪电）这两个单词。
第7题答案：trains
对应原文：
And, I don’t think there are enough
trains
.
That’s why I don’t use them—you have to wait so long.
答案解析：虽然没有什么明确的提示词，但trains读的很重，还是比较好识别，并确定为答案的。
第8题答案：safe
对应原文：
Yep.
Well, I have thought about it and where I work there are no
safe
places to leave your bikes.
答案解析：这道题的考察方式其实更加偏向于Section4，需要大家根据修饰关系，通过parking place来锁定答案。
第9题答案：shower
对应原文：
And also.
I’d have to cycle uphill and on a hot day, I’d arrive at work pretty sweaty so I think I’d need a
shower
somewhere at work.
答案解析：这道题听到shower并不难。但一些同学可能会觉得在工作场所怎么能洗澡呢，于是将它直接排除。这里老烤鸭小编建议大家，在考试时不管听到多么离谱的答案都先写上，然后再看看后面有没有更合适的。切不可直接抛弃，要不然哪怕后面回过神来也很容易忘记。
第10题答案：training
对应原文：I think I’d like to see you offering
training
for that, you know, I’d feel a lot better about starting if that was the case.
答案解析：这道题是该部分最难的一道，既没有提示词，也没有重读，只能根据词性和句义去判断听到的哪个名词填上去比较合适。

剑桥雅思10Test2听力Section2答案解析 New city developments
剑桥雅思10
test2 Section2
雅思听力
原文
Good morning.
I’m very pleased to have this opportunity to say a little about two exciting new developments in the city: the Brackenside Open-Air Swimming Pool and the children’s Adventure Playground in Central Park.
As many of you may know,
the idea for these initiatives came from you, the public(Q11)
, in the
extensive
consultation exercise which the City Council conducted last year.
And they have been realised using money from the SWRDC—the South West Regional Development Commission.
First of all, Brackenside Pool.
As many of the older members of the audience will remember, there used to be a wonderful open-air pool on the sea front 30 years ago but it had to close when it was judged to be unsafe.
For the design of this new heated pool, we were very happy to secure the talents of internationally
renowned
architect Ellen Wendon, who has managed to combine a charming 1930s design, which fits in so well with many of the other buildings in the area, with up-to-the-minute features such as a recycling system -the only one of its kind in the—
which enables seawater to be used in the pool(Q12)
.
Now,
there has been quite a bit of discussion in the local press about whether there would be enough room for the number of visitors we’re hoping to attract(Q13)
, but the design is
deceptive
and there have been rigorous checks about
capacity
.
Also, just in case you were wondering, we’re on schedule for a June 15th opening date and well within budget: a
testimony
to the excellent work of local contractors Hickman’s.
We hope that as many people as possible will be there on June 15th.
We have engaged award-winning actress Coral White to declare the pool open and there’ll be drinks and snacks available at the pool side.
There’ll also be a competition for the public to decide on the
sculpture
we plan to have at the entrance(Q14)
: you will decide which famous historical figure from the city we should have.
And now, moving on to the Central Park Playground, which we’re pleased to announce has just won the
Douglas
Award for safety: the news came through only last week.
The unique design is based on the
concept
of the Global Village, with the playground being divided into six areas showing different parts of the world—each with a
representative
feature.
For example, there is a section on Asia, and
this is represented by rides and equipment in the shape of snakes, orangutans, tigers and so on(Q15)
—
fauna
native to the forests of the region.
Moving south to the Antarctic—we couldn’t run to an ice rink I’m afraid but opted instead for
climbing blocks in the shape of mountains(Q16)
—I thought they could have had slides for the glaciers but the designers did want to avoid being too literal!
Then on to South America—and here the theme is El Dorado—
games replicating the search for mines full of precious Stone(Q17)
.
And then moving up to North America, here there was a
considerable
debate—I know the contribution of cinema and jazz was considered but the designers finally opted for
rockets and the International Space Station(Q18)
.
Eastwards to Europe then, and perhaps the most traditional choice of all the areas:
medieval
castles and other fortifications(Q19)
.
Then last, but not least, moving south to Africa and a whole set of wonderful mosaics and trails to represent the
great rivers(Q20)
of this
fascinating
and varied continent.
Now, the opening date for our Global Playground is 10th July.
And again we’d love to see you there—so make a date and come and see this magnificent, original new
amenity
right in the heart of the city.

剑桥雅思10 Test2 Section2听力答案解析
第11题答案：A
对应原文：As many of you may know,
the idea for these initiatives came from you, the public
, in the
extensive
consultation exercise which the City Council conducted last year
答案解析：这些观点来自于公众，A选项local people与the public同义替换，由此确定答案。B选项City Council去年举办的调查，而SWRDC则负责出钱，均不符合题干所问问题，因此统统排除。
第12题答案：C
对应原文：with up-to-the-minute features such as a recycling system -the only one of its kind in the world—
which enables seawater to be used in the pool
答案解析：这道题的解题关键在于题干中的unusual。录音中虽然说了很多文章来自老烤鸭雅思有关设计风格的问题，但找不到unusual的对应，因此排除A。C选项water treatment与seawater或者recycling system对应，而且还有the only one of its kind的形容（对应unusual），由此确定答案。
第13题答案：C
对应原文：Now,
there has been quite a bit of discussion in the local press about whether there would be enough room for the number of visitors we’re hoping to attract
答案解析：虽然原文中确实提到了opening date和项目花费的问题，但前者已经确定，而后者则是well within budget，均不符合题干中worries about的要求，因此统统排除。B选项size与enough room对应，而且这句中还提到了local press（对应local newspaper)，由此确定答案。
第14题答案：A
对应原文：
There’ll also be a competition for the public to decide on the
sculpture
we plan to have at the entrance
: you will decide which famous historical figure from the city we should have.
答案解析：开业时间和剪彩人员都已经确定，只有雕塑还没有定下来，由此确定答案为A。这道题中，statue和sculpture的同义替换在雅思听力中经常考察，大家可以积累一下。
第15题答案：E
对应原文： For example, there is a section on Asia, and
this is represented by rides and equipment in the shape of snakes, orangutans, tigers and so on
答案解析：听到Asia意识到答案即将到来。虽然orangutans（红毛猩猩）大多数同学都不认识，但我们仍然可以根据snakes和tigers确定答案为E。
第16题答案：F
对应原文：Moving south to the Antarctic—we couldn’t run to an ice rink I’m afraid but opted instead for
climbing blocks in the shape of mountains
答案解析：这道题设置了一个小的干扰项，先否定ice rink（对应C），然后再说答案mountains，由此锁定F。
第17题答案：D
对应原文：Then on to South America—and here the theme is El Dorado—
games replicating the search for mines full of precious Stone
答案解析：这道题的同义替换比较巧妙。需要大家联想到precious stone-宝贵的石头，就是宝石、珠宝的意思，从而确定D为答案。也有同学因为只听到了stone，觉得只有I跟它比较相似，进而选错答案。
第18题答案：H
对应原文：I know the contribution of cinema and jazz was considered but the designers finally opted for
rockets and the International Space Station
答案解析：同样是设置了小小的干扰项。上来先说cinema and jazz（对应G选项），然后转折接正确答案。哪怕大家一开始听到rockets没有反应过来，根据space station也可以确定H为答案。
第19题答案：A
对应原文：Eastwards to Europe then, and perhaps the most traditional choice of all the areas:
medieval
castles and other fortifications
答案解析：虽然不少同学都不认识forts，进而也没办法根据castle和fortification与forts的同义替换来确定A为答案。但我们还可以根据traditional和ancient来辅助做题。
第20题答案：B
对应原文：Then last, but not least, moving south to Africa and a whole set of wonderful mosaics and trails to represent the
great rivers
of this
fascinating
and varied continent.
答案解析：这道题的难点主要在于rivers读的比较轻，而且前面还有mosaics这样一个明显重读，但含义又不太清楚的词汇干扰我们的注意力。不过只要听到了rivers，答案就特别明显了。

And I think it’s unusual for children to develop their own values and not join in their parents’ hobbies;
I’m thinking of how Heyerdahl wouldn’t go hunting with his dad, for example.
OLIVIA
: Yeah, he preferred to learn about nature by listening to his mother read to him.
And quite early on he knew he wanted to become an explorer when he grew up.
That came from his camping trips he went on in Norway I think…

: No, –
it was climbing that he spent his time on as a young man (Q22)

After university he married a classmate and together, – they decided to experience living on a small island, – to

.

: Yes.
When he got started again and planned his
epic

: Um, I haven’t read anywhere that that was his motivation.
The most important factor seems to have been that he use only ancient techniques and local materials to build his
raft (Q27
)
.

: Yes.

VICTOR
: Well, it took them 97 days from South America to the
Pacific
Islands.
OLIVIA
: Mm.
And after that, Heyerdahl went to Easter Island, didn’t he?
We should the purpose of that trip.
I think he sailed there in a boat made out of reeds.
VICTOR
: No, that was later on in Egypt, Olivia.
OLIVIA
: Oh, yes, that’s right.
VICTOR
: But
what he wanted to do was talk to the local people about their old stone carvings and then make one himself to learn more about the process (Q28)

OLIVIA

Well, what a great life.

I agree.
What about the subject matter—I found it realty challenging!
VICTOR
: Well, it’s a complex issue…
OLIVIA
: I thought the book had lots of good points.
What did you think of…

剑桥雅思10 Test2 Section3听力答案解析
第21题答案：B
对应原文：
it was climbing that he spent his time on as a young man
答案解析：在否定camping之后，男生提到是年轻时候的登山经历让他明白自己长大之后想要成为一个探险家。由此确定B为答案。
第22题答案：C
对应原文：Why don’t you begin with describing the type of boy he was, especially –
his passion for collecting things
答案解析：原文中明确提到，他对收集东西很有热情，符合题干中interested in的要求，由此确定C为答案。A选项camping被男生否定；D选项hunting是他父母的活动，他不愿意去；E选项reading也是她母亲给他读故事，而不是自己喜欢阅读。由此统统排除。
第23题答案：B
对应原文：
I guess they needed that knowledge
in order to live wild in a remote location with few inhabitants, cut off by the sea
答案解析：这道题的关键在于对同义替换的理解。原文中说他们居住在一个遥远的地方，只有少许居民，被大海所分割，因此对应B选项中isolated，确定答案。A选项并非是他前往岛屿居住的原因，只是偶尔的发现，不符合题干问题。C选项没有提到。D选项同样不是原因，而是在此过程学习的东西。因此这三个选项统统排除，确定B为答案。
第24题答案：E
对应原文：they decided to experience living on a small island, – to
find out how
harsh
weather conditions shaped people’s lifestyles
答案解析：这道题的同义替换幅度稍微有点大，将harsh weather替换成extreme environment，shape people’s lifestyles替换成impact，需要对句义有一定的理解才能反应过来。
第25题答案：A
对应原文：Yes,
they thought that travel from the east was impossible, because of the huge, empty stretch of ocean that lies between the islands and the nearest inhabited land
答案解析：根据impossible可以确定答案就在这句话里。但far away的替换太过复杂，很容易反应不过来。这时候我们可以利用排除法，先确定B和C选项都是错误的，再反过来思考A选项的对应之处。
第26题答案：C
对应原文：Well,
I think it was more a matter of simply trying out his idea, to see if
migration
from the east was possible
答案解析：这道题有一个小技巧。一般而言，在雅思听力Section3中，如果题干中出现了agree，则录音中基本都会有他人更正（即一个人先说完，另一个人再否定的手法），大家可以注意一下。
第27题答案：C
对应原文：
Um, I haven’t read anywhere that that was his motivation.
The most important factor seems to have been that he use only ancient techniques and local materials to build his
raft
答案解析：根据most important可以判断答案就在这句话里，authentic与ancient对应，construction与build对应，methods与techniques对应，由此确定答案为C。
第28题答案：A
对应原文：But
what he wanted to do was talk to the local people about their old stone carvings and then make one himself to learn more about the process
答案解析：录音中提到，他前往复活节岛的原因是学习雕像制作过程，并自己做一个。A选项statue与carvings同义替换，由此确定答案。B选项是他去埃及的事情，原文中也没有提及他学习语言（对应C选项），因此统统排除。
第29题答案：B
对应原文：
To my mind, he was the first person to establish what modem academics call practical
archaeology
答案解析：这道题的关键在于B选项和C选项的区分。Thor Heyerdahl的主要影响在于创建了实践考古学，即考古学的一种研究方法，而非考古学本身，因此确定B为答案。
第30题答案：A
对应原文：
I thought the research methods he used were very sound, although I must say
I found the overall tone somewhat old-fashioned
答案解析：录音中完全没有提到B选项和C选项，而A选项中的style对应overall tone，out of date对应old-fashioned，由此确定答案。

答案解析

剑桥雅思10Test2听力Section4答案解析 The future of management
剑桥雅思10
test2 Section4
雅思听力
原文
Well, I’ve been talking to managers in a number of businesses, and reading surveys about the future of management.
And what I’m going to present in this seminar is a few ideas about how the activity is likely to change in the next ten years.
It isn’t a scientific,
statistical
analysis—just some ideas for us to discuss.
One area I want to mention is business markets, and I’m sure a really significant development will be a major increase in
competition (Q31)
, with companies from all round the world trying to sell similar products.
Consumers will have much more choice—for
instance
, food products sold in Australia might be manufactured in the USA, China, Finland and dozens of other countries.
At the same time, mergers and takeovers mean that governments are actually losing power to major
global
(Q32)
corporations.
We can probably all think of companies that
exert
a great deal of influence, which may be good for consumers.
A third point I want to make about markets is that in the rapidly expanding economies, such as India, China, Brazil and Russia,
demand (Q33)
is growing very fast.
This is putting pressure on resources all over the world.
I think businesses are becoming more open to external influences.
In
particular
, companies are consulting
customers (Q34)
more and more before making their business decisions.
Companies are finding out what they want and providing it, instead of making products and then trying to sell them, which is the model of years ago.
Another influence is that concerns about the environment will force manufacturers to extend product lifecycles, to reduce the amount of pollution and waste.
And in some cases,
regulation (Q35)
will need to be strengthened.
Many societies are much more
fluid
and
democratic
, and the structure of companies is changing to
reflect
that.
I think we’re going to see a greater emphasis within companies on teams created with a specific
project (Q36)
in mind.
And when they’re completed, the teams will be disbanded and new ones formed.
More and more people see work as simply one part of their lifestyle, and not the most important one, and as the workforce is shrinking in some countries, businesses are having to compete for staff instead of being able to choose among a lot of applicants.
Typical examples that will attract and
retain
staff are traditional ones like
flexible
(Q37)
hours and—something that has been made possible by advances in technology—remote working, with people based at their home, abroad, or almost anywhere they choose.
Management styles will almost certainly continue to change.
Senior managers will require a lot more than the efficiency that they’ve always needed.
Above all they’ll need great skills in
leadership (Q38)
, so that their organisation can
initiate
and respond to change in a fast-moving world, where they face lots of competing requirements and
potential
conflicts.
In most of the world, the senior managers of large businesses are mainly men in their fifties and sixties.
The
predominant
style of management will almost certainly become more
consultative
and
collaborative
, caused above all, by more
women (Q39)
moving into senior management positions.
Many of the changes are influenced by developments in the wider economy.
The traditional emphasis of business was
manufacturing
, and of course the service sector is very important.
But we shouldn’t overlook the growing financial contribution of IP, that is, intellectual property.
Some books and films
generate
enormous sums from the sale of related DVDs, music, games, clothes, and so on.
Another point I’d like to make is that although I’ve been talking about companies, one trend that they have to face is the move away from people working for the same employer for years.
Instead, more and more people are becoming
self-employed (Q40)
, to gain the freedom and control over their lives that they’re unlikely to get from being employed.
OK, well that’s all I want to say, so let’s open it up for discussion.

剑桥雅思10Test2听力Section4答案解析 The future of management
剑桥雅思10听力二套题目第四部分由10道提纲型填空题组成。无论是出题方式，还是题目难度都跟现在雅思听力考试Section4几乎完全相同，是一篇非常好的练习材料。其中33题和39题难度稍大，其他都很一般。下面是具体每道题目的答案解析。

重点词汇

剑桥雅思10Test2Section4听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑10 test 2 section 4 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思10 Test1 Section4听力答案解析
第31题答案：competition
对应原文：One area I want to mention is business markets, and I’m sure a really significant development will be a major increase in
competition
答案解析：听到business markets意识到答案即将到来，greater与increase同义替换，由此确定competition是答案。一些同学可能会因为significant与greater的对应，以为答案是development。但这个词填上去之后，并不符合后面among companies的含义，由此排除。
第32题答案：global
对应原文：
At the same time, mergers and takeovers mean that governments are actually losing power to major
global
corporations
答案解析：听到power意识到答案即将到来，corporations与companies同义替换，根据修饰关系确定global为答案。
第33题答案：demand
对应原文：A third point I want to make about markets is that in the rapidly expanding economies, such as India, China, Brazil and Russia,
demand
is growing very fast
答案解析：一些同学可能会将economies当作答案写上去。但economies在这里表示的是经济体，即后面提到的那些国家，而非经济。如果填上去的话就会跟题干后面的countries重复，由此排除。rising与growing对应，由此确定答案为demand。
第34题答案：customers
对应原文：
I think businesses are becoming more open to external influences.
In
particular
, companies are consulting
customers
more and more before making their business decisions.
答案解析：这道题其实就是考察discussion与consulting的同义替换，但由于小标题external influences距离答案太近，很容易反应不过来。这里老烤鸭小编要提醒大家的是，如果小标题下第一行出题，那么答案与小标题之间可能没有很长的过渡句，需要万分警惕。
第35题答案：regulation
对应原文：And in some cases,
regulation
will need to be strengthened
答案解析：这道题比较考验大家的耐心，需要一一排除lifecyles, pollution以及waste才能等到答案。lifecycles是因为不符合题干含义，而pollution和waste则是因为并列。
第36题答案：project
对应原文：I think we’re going to see a greater emphasis within companies on teams created with a specific
project
in mind
答案解析：听到teams意识到答案即将到来，specific与particular同义替换，由此确定答案为project。
第37题答案：flexible
对应原文：Typical examples that will attract and
retain
staff are traditional ones like
flexible
hours and—something that has been made possible by advances in technology—remote working
答案解析：这道题的难点在于没有明显的提示词，而且采用了语序颠倒的手法，不过hours读的很重的，根据修饰关系还是比较好确定flexible为答案。
第38题答案：leadership
对应原文：
Above all they’ll need great skills in
leadership
, so that their organisation can
initiate
and respond to change in a fast-moving world
答案解析：great与good同义替换，因此锁定skills和leadership这两个单词，其中skills填上去之后与题干含义不符，由此排除，确定leadership为答案。
第39题答案：women
对应原文：The
predominant
style of management will almost certainly become more
consultative
and
collaborative
, caused above all, by more
women
moving into senior management positions.
答案解析：这道题的难点主要在于断句。如果大家事先认为空与changes influenced by是一个意群，那么只能根据句义理解来确定答案，难度大大增加。如果认为空与taking senior roles是一个意群，那么听到senior management positions之后，就可以根据回忆确定women为答案。
第40题答案：self-employed
对应原文：Instead, more and more people are becoming
self-employed
, to gain the freedom and control over their lives that they’re unlikely to get from being employed.
答案解析：这道题比较简单，根据more and more可以很轻易的锁定self-employed，注意下单词拼写即可。

剑桥雅思10Test3听力Section1答案解析 Early Learning Childcare Centre Enrolment Form
剑桥雅思10
test3 Section1
雅思听力
原文
DIRECTOR
: Good morning.
Welcome to the Early Learning Childcare Centre.
How may I help you?
CAROL
: Hi.
I spoke to you last week about enrolling my daughter for next year.
DIRECTOR
: Oh, yes.
I’ll just get some details from you.
So, you’re her mother?
CAROL
: That’s right.
DIRECTOR
: And, can I have your name?
CAROL
: It’s Carol, Carol Smith.
DIRECTOR
: And your daughter’s name?
CAROL
: It’s Kate.
DIRECTOR
: Now, we have several groups at the centre and we
cater
for children from three to five years old.
How old is your daughter?
CAROL
: She’s three now but she turns four next month.
DIRECTOR
: I’ll put
four (Q1)
down because that’s how old she’ll be when she starts.
CAROL
: Fine, she’s so excited about her birthday and coming to the centre.
DIRECTOR
: That’s good to hear.
And what’s your address?
CAROL
: It’s
46 Wombat Road (Q2)
, that’s W-O-M-B-A-T.
Woodside 4032.
DIRECTOR
: And what’s the phone number?
CAROL
: Oh …
it’s … 3345 9865.
DIRECTOR
: So, have you decided on the days you’d like to bring your daughter here?
CAROL
: I’d prefer Monday and Wednesday if possible.
DIRECTOR
: Mmm.
I’ll check.
Monday’s fine, but I think the centre is already full for Wednesday.
Erm.
Yes.
Sorry.
It seems to be a very popular day.
We can offer you a Thursday or a Friday as well.
CAROL
: Oh dear.
I suppose
Thursday (Q3)
would be all right because she has swimming on Friday.
DIRECTOR
: OK, got that.
Because a lot of parents work, we do offer
flexible
start and finish times.
We are open from 7:30 in the morning until 6 o’clock at night.
What time would you like your daughter to start?
CAROL
: I need to get to work in the city by 9:00 so I’ll drop her off at
8:30 (Q4)
.
You’re pretty dose to the city here so that should give me plenty of time to get there.
DIRECTOR
: That’s fine.
Now, we also need to decide which group she’ll be in.
We have two different groups and they’re divided up according to age.
There’s the green group, which is for three- to four-year-olds.
And then there’s the
red (Q5)
group which is for four- to five-year-olds.
CAROL
: She’s quite mature for her age and she can already write her name and read a little.
DIRECTOR
: Well.
I’ll put her in the red group and we can always change her to the green one if there are any problems.
CAROL
: That sounds fine.
DIRECTOR
: OK.
Let’s move on to meals.
We can provide breakfast, lunch and dinner.
As she’s finishing pretty early, she won’t need dinner, will you give her breakfast before she comes?
CAROL
: Yes, she’ll only need
lunch (Q6)
.
DIRECTOR
: Now, does she have any medical conditions we need to know about?
Does she have
asthma
or any hearing problems for example?
CAROL
: No.
But she does need to wear
glasses (Q7)
.
DIRECTOR
: Oh, I’ll make a note of that.
CAROL
: Yes, she’s pretty good about wearing them, she can’t see much without them.
DIRECTOR
: Right.
OK.
Now, I also need
emergency
contact details.
CAROL
: So what sort of information do you need?
DIRECTOR
: Just the name and number of a friend or family member we can contact in case we can’t get hold of you at any time.
CAROL
: OK.
That’d better be my sister…
Jenny Ball.
That’s
B-A-double L (Q8)
.
Her phone number is 3346 7523.
DIRECTOR
: Great.
So she is the child’s
aunt (Q9)
?
CAROL
: Yes, that’s right.
DIRECTOR
: I’ll make a note of that as well.
Now, is there anything you’d like to ask?
CAROL
: What about payment?
How much are the fees each term?
DIRECTOR
: Well, for two days and the hours you’ve chosen, that will be $450
altogether
.
CAROL
: OK, and do I have to pay that now?
DIRECTOR
: No, we send out invoices once the children start at the centre.
You can choose to pay at the end of each term or we do offer a slightly discounted rate if you pay
every month (Q10)
.
CAROL
: Oh.
I’ll do that then.
I find it easier to
budget
that way and I’m not used to the term dates just yet.
DIRECTOR
: Good, it makes it a lot simpler for us as well.
Well, that’s everything.
Would you like me to show you around…?
剑桥雅思10 Test3 Section1雅思听力答案
1. 4
2. 46 Wombat
3. Thursday
4. 8.30
5. red
6. lunch
7. glasses
8. Ball
9. aunt
10. month

剑桥雅思10Test3听力Section1答案解析 Early Learning Childcare Centre Enrolment Form
剑桥雅思10听力第三套题目第一部分由10道笔记填空题构成，虽然出现了各种各样的干扰项，但整体难度并不算是很大。考察的知识点包括数字，地址，时间，周几，姓名拼写等常见内容。下面是具体每道题目的答案解析。
点击查看这篇
雅思听力
对应的
录音原文
与其中出现的需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思10Test3Section1听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑10 test 3 section 1 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思10 Test3 Section1听力答案解析
第1题答案：4
对应原文：
CAROL
: She’s three now but she turns four next month.
DIRECTOR
: I’ll put
four
down because that’s how old she’ll be when she starts.
答案解析：女性说自己的孩子现在3岁，下个月4岁，然后男性说那就登记成4岁，因此答案为4，而不是3。雅思听力Section1中经常出现这种前者给出两个选择，等后者来确定的情况。大家听到第一个人说话的时候不要着急，等第二个人说完，答案就很明确了。
第2题答案：46 Wombat
对应原文：
It’s
46 Wombat Road
, that’s W-O-M-B-A-T.
Woodside 4032
答案解析：考察地址和名字拼写这两个知识点。不过录音中m读的有些像n。搞混淆的同学可以多注意下两个鼻音的差别。
第3题答案：Thursday
对应原文：
DIRECTOR
: Mmm.
I’ll check.
Monday’s fine, but I think the centre is already full for Wednesday.
Erm.
Yes.
Sorry.
It seems to be a very popular day.
We can offer you a Thursday or a Friday as well.
CAROL
: Oh dear.
I suppose
Thursday
would be all right because she has swimming on Friday.
答案解析：男性给了Thursday和Friday两个选择，女性肯定Thursday，否定了Friday。
第4题答案：8.30
对应原文： I need to get to work in the city by 9:00 so I’ll drop her off at
8:30
答案解析：这道题找到答案位置并不难，但8读的很轻，非常不容易识别。一开始没听清楚的同学可以根据上下文稍微推测一下。
第5题答案：red
对应原文：
Well.
I’ll put her in the
red
group and we can always change her to the green one if there are any problems.
答案解析：又是男性给了两个选项，最后女性选了red这一组。还是那句话，大家一定要等到后者说话才能确定答案。不到万不得已，千万不要自己推测。
第6题答案：lunch
对应原文：
DIRECTOR
: OK.
Let’s move on to meals.
We can provide breakfast, lunch and dinner.
As she’s finishing pretty early, she won’t need dinner, will you give her breakfast before she comes?
CAROL
: Yes, she’ll only need
lunch
答案解析：部分同学可能听到yes之后觉得breakfast是答案。但录音中说的是孩子来之前，女性会给她准备早饭，而非需要机构准备什么。因此排除breakfast，选择lunch。
第7题答案：glasses
对应原文：
No.
But she does need to wear
glasses
答案解析：glasses表示眼镜的意思，这个知识点我们在初中的时候应该都学过。
第8题答案：BALL
对应原文：
OK.
That’d better be my sister…
Jenny Ball.
That’s
B-A-double L
答案解析：雅思听力中哪怕再简单的人名也会给拼写，所以大家在平时复习的时候并不需要特意的去记人名。
第9题答案：aunt
对应原文：
Great.
So she is the child’s
aunt
答案解析：考察亲属关系，单词拼写不难，读的也很重，几乎属于送分题。
第10题答案：month
对应原文：
You can choose to pay at the end of each term or we do offer a slightly discounted rate if you pay
every month
CAROL
: Oh. I’ll do that then. I find it easier to
budget
that way and I’m not used to the term dates just yet.
答案解析：考察指代和干扰项。这里又是先说了正确答案，然后才否定干扰项。所以大家切不可以为后面的都是正确的。

剑桥雅思10Test3Section2听力原文与答案 Dolphin conservation trust
剑桥雅思10听力第三套题目第二部分介绍了某个海豚保护组织，具体内容包括该组织的现状，所赢得的奖项，石油勘探带来的影响，组织成立的初衷，以及4种海豚的特点。
点击查看这篇雅思听力中需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
与具体题目的
答案解析
：
雅思备考听力篇 剑10 test 3 section 2 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思10Test3Section2听力答案解析 Dolphin Conservation Trust
剑桥雅思10
test3 Section2
雅思听力
原文
INTERVIEWER
: Today we’re pleased to have on the show Alice Bussell from the
Dolphin
Conservation Trust.
Tell us about the Trust, Alice.
ALICE
: Well, obviously its purpose is to protect dolphins in seas all around the world.
It tries to raise people’s awareness of the problems these marine creatures are suffering because of pollution and other threats.
It started ten years ago and it’s one of the fastest growing animal charities in the country—although it’s still fairly small compared with the big players in animal protection.
We are particularly proud of the work we do in education—last year we visited a huge number of schools in different parts of the country, going round to talk to children and young people aged from five to eighteen.
In fact, about thirty-five per cent of our members are children.
The charity uses its money to support campaigns—for example, for changes in fishing policy and so forth (Q11)
.
It hopes soon to be able to employ its first full-time biologist—with
dolphin
expertise—to monitor populations.
Of course, many people give their services on a voluntary basis and –
we now have volunteers working in
observation
, office work and other things (Q12)
.
I should also tell you about the award we won from the Charity Commission last year—for our work in education.
Although it’s not meant an enormous amount of money for us,
it has made our activities even more widely publicised and understood (Q13)
.
In the long term it may not bring in extra members but we’re hoping it’ll have this effect.
INTERVIEWER
: Is it possible to see dolphins in UK waters?
ALICE
: Yes.
In several locations.
And we have a big project in the east part of Scotland.
This has long been a haven for dolphins because it has very little shipping.
However, that may be about to change soon because oil companies want to increase exploration there.
We’re campaigning against this because, although there’ll be little pollution from oil,
exploration creates a lot of underwater noise (Q14)
.
It means the dolphins can’t rest and socialise.
This is how I became interested in
dolphin
conservation in the first place.
I had never seen one and I hadn’t been particularly interested in them at school.
Then I came across this story about a family of dolphins who had to leave their home in the Moray Firth because of the oil companies and about a child who campaigned to save them.
I couldn’t put the book down—I was hooked (Q15)
.
INTERVIEWER
: I’m sure our listeners will want to find out what they can do to help.
You mentioned the ‘Adopt a
Dolphin
‘
scheme
.
Can you tell us about that?
ALICE
: Of course!
People can choose one of our dolphins to
sponsor
.
They receive a picture of it and news updates.
I’d like to tell you about four which are currently being adopted by our members: Moondancer, Echo, Kiwi and Samson.
Unfortunately,
Echo is being rather
elusive
this year and hasn’t yet been sighted by our observers (Q16)
but we remain optimistic that he’ll be out there soon.
All the others have been out in force—Samson and Moondancer are often photographed together but
it is Kiwi who’s our real ‘character’ as she seems to love coming up close for the cameras (Q17)
and we’ve captured her on film hundreds of times.
They all have their own personalities— Moondancer is very elegant and curves out and into the water very smoothly,
whereas
Samson has a lot of energy (Q18)
—he‘s always leaping out of the water with great vigour.
You’d probably expect him to be the youngest—he’s not quite—that’s Kiwi—but
Samson’s the latest of our dolphins to be chosen for the
scheme (Q19)
.
Kiwi makes a lot of noise so we can often pick her out straightaway.
Echo and Moondancer are noisy too, but
Moondancer’s easy to find because she has a particularly large
fin
on her back (Q20)
, which makes her easy to identify.
So, yes, they’re all very different…
INTERVIEWER
: Well, they sound a
fascinating
group…
剑桥雅思10 Test3 Section2雅思听力答案
11. C
12. E
13. B
14. A
15. C
16. B
17. C
18. D
19. D
20. A

剑桥雅思10听力第三套题目第二部分由1道5选2的多选，3道单项选择，和5道匹配题组成。整体难度不算太大，出题方式也很符合目前雅思听力的特点，大家可以用它来检测下自己目前的水平。
点击查看这篇
雅思听力
对应的
录音原文
与其中出现的需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思10Test3Section2听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑10 test 3 section 2 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思10 Test3 Section2听力答案解析
第11题答案：C
对应原文：The charity uses its money to support campaigns—for example, for changes in fishing policy and so forth
答案解析：C选项将原文中的uses its money to support第换成finance，其他基本没有变化，由此确定为正确答案。
第12题答案：E
对应原文： we now have volunteers working in
observation
, office work and other things
答案解析：E选项用in various ways概括了原文中observation, office work等内容，由此确定为正确答案。这道题不少同学可能会选D，其错误主要在于，选项中用的是一般现在时，即现在雇有海豚专家，而录音中则说的是it hopes，即希望雇佣，其实现在还没有，由此排除。
第13题答案：B
对应原文：
Although it’s not meant an enormous amount of money for us,
it has made our activities even more widely publicised and understood
.
In the long term it may not bring in extra members but we’re hoping it’ll have this effect.
答案解析：这道题三个选项在原文中都有对应的点。A选项extra money对应an enormous amount of money，但文章来自老烤鸭雅思前面有否定，因此排除。C选项more members对应extra members，但前面依然有否定，也排除。B选项中better known对应more widely publicised and understood，而且前面没有任何否定词，由此确定为答案。
第14题答案：A
对应原文：We’re campaigning against this because, although there’ll be little pollution from oil,
exploration creates a lot of underwater noise
答案解析：C选项完全没有提到，B选项勉强可以对应录音中的pollution from oil，但前面有little这一否定词，因此排除。A选项对应underwater noise，由此确定答案。
第15题答案：C
对应原文：
Then I came across this story about a family of dolphins who had to leave their home in the Moray Firth because of the oil companies and about a child who campaigned to save them.
I couldn’t put the book down—I was hooked
答案解析：原文中虽然提到了A选项和B选项，但前面都有否定，因此排除。只有C选项能够对应录音汇总couldn’t put the book down，由此确定答案。
第16题答案：B
对应原文：Unfortunately,
Echo is being rather
elusive
this year and hasn’t yet been sighted by our observers
答案解析：这5道匹配都不算太难，只要大家守好题干中的限定条件，不要被原文中的描述所干扰，就能比较容易的确定答案。16题seen与sighted同义替换，由此确定Echo为答案
第17题答案：C
对应原文：All the others have been out in force—Samson and Moondancer are often photographed together but
it is Kiwi who’s our real ‘character’ as she seems to love coming up close for the cameras
答案解析：虽然前面提到了Samson and Moondancer，但一方面它们两个是并列，要选的话得一起选，而题目只能填一个答案。另一方面，它们后面还有转折，需要关注but后的内容。由此排除Samson和Moondancer，确定C Kiwi为答案。
第18题答案：D
对应原文：They all have their own personalities— Moondancer is very elegant and curves out and into the water very smoothly,
whereas
Samson has a lot of energy
答案解析：energy与energetic同义替换，很容易确定Samson为答案。
第19题答案：D
对应原文：You’d probably expect him to be the youngest—he’s not quite—that’s Kiwi—but
Samson’s the latest of our dolphins to be chosen for the
scheme
答案解析：这道题主要考察同义替换。一些同学可能觉得yongest是最高级，跟题干中newest的意思有些相近，就将Kiwi确定为答案。但一方面Kiwi后面有but，另一方面latest明显更加对应newest的要求，由此确定D为答案，而不是C。
第20题答案：A
对应原文：Echo and Moondancer are noisy too, but
Moondancer’s easy to find because she has a particularly large
fin
on her back
答案解析：录音中将题干上的unusual shape具象化，变成particularly large fin，由此确定答案为Moondancer。

test3 Section3

原文
MIA
: Hi, Rob.
How’s the course going?
ROB
: Oh, hi, Mia.
Yeah, great.
I can’t believe the first term’s nearly over.
MIA
: I saw your group’s performance last night at the student theatre.
It was good.
ROB
: Really?
Yeah …
but now we have to write a report on the whole thing, an
in-depth
analysis.
I don’t know where to start.
Like, I have to write about the role I played, the doctor, how I developed the character.
MIA
: Well, what was your starting point?
ROB
: Er…
my grandfather was a doctor before he retired, and I just based it on him.
MIA
: OK, but how?
Did you talk to him about it?
ROB
: He must have all sorts of stories, but he never says much about his work, even now.
He has a sort of authority though.
MIA
: So how did you manage to capture that?
ROB
:
I’d… I’d
visualise
what he must have been like in the past, when he was sitting in his consulting room listening to his patients  (Q21)
.
MIA
: OK, so that’s what you explain in your report.
ROB
: Right.
MIA
: Then there’s the issue of atmosphere—so in the first scene we needed to know how boring life was in the doctor’s village in the 1950s, so when the curtain went up on the first scene in the waiting room, there was that long silence before anyone spoke.
And then
people kept saying the same thing over and over, like ‘Cold, isn’t it?’ (Q22)
ROB
: Yes, and everyone wore grey and brown, and just sat in a row.
MIA
: Yes, all those details of the production.
ROB
: And I have to analyse how I functioned in the group—what I found out about myself.
I know I was so
frustrated
at times, when we couldn’t agree.
MIA
: Yes.
So did one person emerge as the leader?
ROB
: Sophia did.
That was OK—
she helped us work out exactly what to do (Q23)
, for the production.
And that made me feel better, I suppose.
MIA
: When you understood what needed doing?
ROB
: Yes.
And Sophia did some research, too.
That was useful in developing our approach.
MIA
: Like what?
ROB
: Well,
she found these articles from the 1950s about how relationships between children and their parents, or between the public and people like bank managers or the police were shifting (Q24)
.
MIA
: Interesting.
And did you have any practical problems to overcome?
ROB
: Well, in the final
rehearsal
everything was going fine until the last scene -that’s where the doctor’s first patient appears on stage on his own.
MIA
: The one in the wheelchair?
ROB
: Yes, and he had this really long speech, with the stage all dark except for one
spotlight
— and then
that stuck somehow so it was shining on the wrong side of the stage (Q25)
… but anyway we got that fixed, thank goodness.
MIA
: Yes, it was fine on the night.
ROB
: But while you’re here, Mia.
I wanted to ask you about the year abroad option.
Would you recommend doing that?
MIA
: Yes, definitely.
It’s a fantastic chance to study in another country for a year.
ROB
: I think I’d like to do it, but it looks very
competitive
—there’s only a limited number of places.
MIA
: Yes,
so next year when you are in the second year of the course, you need to work really hard in all your theatre studies modules.
Only students with marks get places — you have to prove that you know your subject really well (Q26)
.
ROB
: Right.
So how did you choose where to go?
MIA
: Well,
I decided I wanted a programme that would fit in with what I wanted to do after I graduate, so I looked for a university with emphasis on acting rather than directing for example (Q27)
.
It depends on you.
Then about six months before you go,
you have to email the
scheme
coordinator
with your top three choices.
I had a friend who missed the deadline and didn’t get her first choice (Q28)
, so you do need to get a move on at that stage.

: And don’t you have to write a personal statement at that stage?
MIA
: Yes.
ROB
: Right.
I’ll get some of the final year students to give me some tips (Q29)
…
maybe see if I can read what they wrote.

: I think that’s a very good idea.
I don’t mind showing you what I did.
And while you’re abroad don’t make the mistake I made.

.
Make sure you stay in touch so they know your choices for the optional modules.
You don’t want to miss out doing your preferred specialisms.
ROB
: Right.

剑桥雅思10 Test3 Section3听力答案解析
第21题答案：C
对应原文：I’d… I’d
visualise
what he must have been like in the past, when he was sitting in his consulting room listening to his patients
答案解析：录音中说，他爷爷不怎么讲自己的工作，因此排除A选项。visualise是幻想，想象的意思，而非看到，因此排除B，选C。
第22题答案：A
对应原文：
so when the curtain went up on the first scene in the waiting room, there was that long silence before anyone spoke.
And then
people kept saying the same thing over and over, like ‘Cold, isn’t it?’
答案解析：A选项用repetition替换over and over，由此确定答案。B选项的dull color虽然对应grey and brown，但录音中说的是文章来自老烤鸭雅思人的穿着，而非布景，由此排除B。C选项long pauses对应long silence，但这是在开始之前，而不是在对话中，因此也排除。
第23题答案：A
对应原文：
Sophia did.
That was OK—
she helped us work out exactly what to do
, for the production
答案解析：guideline是指导方针，准则的意思，替换录音中的what to do，由此确定A为答案。B选项完全没有提到。C选项则错在Sophia，而非他自己是领袖。
第24题答案：B
对应原文：Well,
she found these articles from the 1950s about how relationships between children and their parents, or between the public and people like bank managers or the police were shifting
答案解析：B选项Social是对children and their parents, public and people的总结，由此确定答案。A和C都跟这些具体内容有些不沾边。
第25题答案：B
对应原文：Yes, and he had this really long speech, with the stage all dark except for one
spotlight
— and then
that stuck somehow so it was shining on the wrong side of the stage
答案解析：这道题希望利用大家的过度推测来进行误导。原文中提到一名演员坐着轮椅，但并没有说他受伤（C选项）；提到台词很长，但没有说忘词（A选项）。最终出错的只有聚光灯，由此确定B为答案。
第26题答案：E
对应原文：
Yes,
so next year when you are in the second year of the course, you need to work really hard in all your theatre studies modules.
Only students with marks get places — you have to prove that you know your subject really well
答案解析：录音中提到，你得努力学习，只有成绩特别好才能得到机会，还得证明自己对这一科目了解很深。选项中能够与此对应的只有E。
第27题答案：D
对应原文：Well,
I decided I wanted a programme that would fit in with what I wanted to do after I graduate, so I looked for a university with emphasis on acting rather than directing for example
答案解析：女生用自己的经历举例，选择的项目必须符合自己毕业后想做的事情，fit与relevant同义替换，由此确定D为答案。
第28题答案：A
对应原文：
Then about six months before you go,
you have to email the
scheme
coordinator
with your top three choices.
I had a friend who missed the deadline and didn’t get her first choice
答案解析：deadline与on time同义替换，由此确定答案为A。雅思听力中这组同义替换经常出现，大家可以稍微注意一下。
第29题答案：G
对应原文：
Right.
I’ll get some of the final year students to give me some tips
…
maybe see if I can read what they wrote.
答案解析：录音中说，他会寻找毕业年级的学生给一些建议。G选项ask for help是对此的概括，由此确定答案。
第30题答案：C
对应原文：
And while you’re abroad don’t make the mistake I made.
I got so involved I forgot all about making arrangements for when I came back here for the final year
答案解析：plan与making arrangements同义替换，final year原词出现，由此确定C选项为答案。

内容:
剑桥雅思10Test3Section4听力原文与答案 self-regulatory focus theory and leadership
剑桥雅思10听力第三套题目第四部分的主题为self-regulatory focus theory and leadership，内容包括理论的具体情况，影响人们关注点的因素和作用机制，两种不同类型的领袖等。因为整体语速偏慢，所以难度并不是很大。
点击查看这篇雅思听力中需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
与具体题目的
答案解析
：
雅思备考听力篇 剑10 test 3 section 4 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思10Test3Section4听力答案解析 self-regulatory focus theory and leadership
剑桥雅思10
test3 Section4
雅思听力
原文
Today, I want to talk about self-regulatory focus theory and how the actions of leaders can affect the way followers approach different situations.
Self-regulatory focus theory is a theory developed by Tori Higgins.
He says that a person’s focus at any given time is to either approach pleasure or avoid pain.
These are two basic motivations that each and every one of us has, and they cause us to have different kinds of goals.
Promotion goals in different life situations emphasise
achievement (Q31)
.
Prevention goals are oriented towards the avoidance of punishment.
In a specific situation, our thoughts might focus more on promotion goals or more on prevention goals.
The theory suggests that two factors affect which goals we are focusing on.
First, there is a
chronic
factor.
This factor is connected to a person’s
personality (Q32)
and says that each person has a basic tendency to either focus more on promotion goals or focus more on prevention goals as part of his or her personality.
Second, there is a
situational (Q33)
factor which means that the context we are in can make us more likely to focus on one set of goals or the other.
For example, we are more likely to be thinking about pleasure and to have promotion goals when we are spending time with a
friend
(Q34)
.
In contrast, if we are working on an important project for our boss, we are more likely to try to avoid making mistakes and therefore have more prevention goals in our mind.
Research has shown that the goals we are focusing on at a given time affect the way we think.
For example, when focusing on promotion goals, people consider their ideal self, their
aspirations (Q35)
and gains.
They don’t think about what they can lose, so they think in a happier mode.
They feel more inspired to change.
When people are focusing on prevention goals, they think about their “ought” self.
What are they supposed to be?
What are people expecting from them?
They consider their obligations to others.
As a result, they experience more anxiety and try to avoid situations where they could lose.
Now that I have talked about the two focuses and how they affect people, I want to look at the idea that the way leaders behave, or their
style (Q36)
of leading, can affect the focus that followers adopt in a specific situation.
In talking about leadership, we often mention transformational leaders and transactional leaders.
Transformational leaders, when interacting with their followers, focus on their
development (Q37)
.
In their words and actions transformational leaders highlight change.
Their speech is passionate and conveys a
definitive
vision (Q38)
.
All of these things can encourage followers to think about what could be.
In other words, they inspire a promotion focus in their followers.
In contrast, transactional leaders focus on developing clear
structures (Q39)
that tell their followers exactly what is expected of them.
While they do explain the rewards people will get for following orders, they emphasise more how a follower will be punished or that a follower won’t get rewarded if his or her behaviour doesn’t change.
In short, they emphasise the consequences of making a mistake.
This emphasis will clearly lead followers to focus on avoiding punishment and problems.
This is clearly a prevention focus.
In conclusion, it is important to understand that one focus is not necessarily better than the other one.
For a designer who works in a field where a lot of
innovation
(Q40)
is needed, a promotion focus is probably better.
In contrast, a prevention focus which causes people to work more cautiously and produce higher quality work might be very appropriate for a job like a surgeon, for example.
The main point of the research, though, is that the actions of leaders can greatly influence whether people approach a situation with more of a promotion focus or more of a prevention focus.
剑桥雅思10 Test3 Section4雅思听力答案
31. achievement/achievements
32. personality/character
33. situational
34. friend
35. aspirations/ambitions
36. style
37. development
38. vision
39. structures
40. innovation/innovations

剑桥雅思10Test3Section4听力答案解析 self-regulatory focus theory and leadership
剑桥雅思10听力第三套题目第四部分由10道提纲型填空题组成。因为语速很慢，各种提示词都比较明显，整体难度偏低。只有最后几道题稍微设置了些障碍。下面是具体每道题目的答案解析。

重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思10Test3Section4听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑10 test 3 section 4 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思10 Test3 Section4听力答案解析
第31题答案：achievement/achievements
对应原文：
Promotion goals in different life situations emphasise
achievement
.
Prevention goals are oriented towards the avoidance of punishment.
答案解析：听到promotion goals意识到答案即将到来，空前词focus on与emphasise同义替换，由此确定答案为achievement。
第32题答案：personality/character
对应原文：
The theory suggests that two factors affect which goals we are focusing on.
First, there is a
chronic
factor.
This factor is connected to a person’s
personality
答案解析：听到chronic factor意识到答案即将到来。one’s与person’s同义替换，由此确定答案为personality。
第33题答案：situational
对应原文：
Second, there is a
situational
factor which means that the context we are in can make us more likely to focus on one set of goals or the other.
答案解析：听到second意识到上一行已经结束，即将来到33题。题干中factor原词出现，根据修饰关系，确定答案为situational。
第34题答案：friend
对应原文：For example, we are more likely to be thinking about pleasure and to have promotion goals when we are spending time with a
friend
答案解析：听到promotion goals意识到答案即将出现，空前介词with原词出现，由此确定答案。
第35题答案：aspirations/ambitions
对应原文：For example, when focusing on promotion goals, people consider their ideal self, their
aspirations
and gains
答案解析：这道题的定位并不难，ideal和gains都是原词出现，而且录音中并列的节奏很明显，难度主要在于aspiration（渴望，志向）的拼写上。
第36题答案：style
对应原文：Now that I have talked about the two focuses and how they affect people, I want to look at the idea that the way leaders behave, or their
style
of leading
答案解析：这道题的难点在于答案出现的有些突然，几乎是紧跟着小标题leader，很容易让人反应不过来。这里老烤鸭小编要提醒大家的是，小标题下第一行出题的，经常出现这种紧跟答案的现象，需要调整一下预期。
第37题答案：development
对应原文：Transformational leaders, when interacting with their followers, focus on their
development
答案解析：听到transformational leaders意识到答案即将到来，focus on与pay special attention to同义替换，由此确定答案为development。
第38题答案：vision
对应原文：
In their words and actions transformational leaders highlight change.
Their speech is passionate and conveys a
definitive
vision
答案解析：这道题虽然没有明显的提示词，但communicate与convey同义替换，clear对应definitive，只要能识别出这两组中的任何一个，答案就不算难。
第39题答案：structures
对应原文：In contrast, transactional leaders focus on developing clear
structures
that tell their followers exactly what is expected of them
答案解析：听到transcational leaders意识到答案即将到来。create与develop同义替换，由此锁定structures。这里需要注意的是，develop除了发展之外，还有从无到有开发的意思，在雅思听力中经常跟create对应。
第40题答案：innovation/innovations
对应原文：For a designer who works in a field where a lot of
innovation
is needed, a promotion focus is probably better.
答案解析：这道题一方面没有明显的提示词，另一方面采用语序颠倒的手法，将空前词requiring对应的need放到了答案之后，比较考验大家的短期记忆能力。

test4 Section1
雅思听力
原文
MR THORNDYKE
: Thorndyke’s.
EDITH
: Good morning.
Is that Mr Thorndyke?
MR THORNDYKE
: Speaking.
How can I help?
EDITH
: I’ve got quite a few things which need painting and fixing in the flat and I wonder whether you’d be able to do the work.
MR THORNDYKE
: I’m sure I’d be able to help but let me take down a few details.
EDITH
: Yes, of course.
MR THORNDYKE
: Well, firstly, how did you hear about us?
EDITH
: It was my friend May Hampton…
you did some excellent work for her a couple of years ago. D
o you remember?
MR THORNDYKE
: Oh, yes, that was in West Park Flats, lovely lady.
EDITH
: Yes, she is.
MR THORNDYKE
: And what’s your name, please?
EDITH
: It’s Edith
Pargetter (Q1)
.
MR THORNDYKE
: Edith …
can you spell your surname, please?
EDITH
: It’s P-A-R-G-E-double T-E-R.
MR THORNDYKE
: Double T, right.
And do you live in West Park Flats as well?
EDITH
: No, actually it’s
East (Q2)
Park. Flat 4.
MR THORNDYKE
: Oh, right, that’s over the road, I seem to remember—quite difficult to get to.
EDITH
: Yes, it’s at the back of the
library (Q3)
.
MR THORNDYKE
: Right, I know.
And what’s your phone number?
EDITH
: 875934 but I’m out a great deal in the afternoons and evenings.
MR THORNDYKE
: So would the best time to ring you be in the
morning (Q4)
?
EDITH
: Yes.
MR THORNDYKE
: Fine.
I’ve made a note of that.
Can I just ask, I’ll be in a van and I know parking’s rather difficult round your flats.
Where would you recommend?
EDITH
: Well, I always tell people in larger vehicles to park by the
postbox (Q5)
on the other side of the road from the entrance.
MR THORNDYKE
: Good, thanks.
EDITH:
And will you be able to give me a full itemised quote?
MR THORNDYKE
: Oh, yes, I’ll list all the jobs separately with individual
prices (Q6)
.
EDITH
: That’d be a great help.
MR THORNDYKE
: No problem.
MR THORNDYKE
: Now, what would you like me to do?
EDITH
: Firstly and most urgently is in the kitchen.
With all the weather damage, the
glass (Q7)
in the door has cracked and I’d need that fixing…
MR THORNDYKE
: I presume you mean replacing?
EDITH
: Oh, yes.
And as soon as possible…
MR THORNDYKE
: What I’ll do is come round tomorrow morning and do that immediately.
EDITH
: Thank you so much.
The other things aren’t so urgent but…
MR THORNDYKE
: Now, I’ll make a note of everything you want doing.
EDITH
: Well, in the kitchen I’d like some painting doing.
MR THORNDYKE
: All the kitchen walls?
EDITH
: Just the area over the
cooker (Q8)
.
It’s very greasy…
MR THORNDYKE
: Right…
it does tend to get that way!
EDITH
: Yes!
MR THORNDYKE
: Well, if you want a proper job done what I’d need to do is
strip
the old paint and
plaster
it about a
week (Q9)
before I paint it.
EDITH
: Of course.
Now, May tells me you also do work in the garden.
MR THORNDYKE
: That’s right.

: Well, I’d like you to replace a

.
MR THORNDYKE
: Just one?

Yes, at the far end.

Shouldn’t be a problem.
