内容:
剑桥雅思5 Test3听力Section2答案解析 独家
剑桥雅思5听力第三套题目第二部分的10道题由1道五选二的多选，3道填空，以及5道选择组成。整体而言难度不大，尤其是中间的填空，只要能跟上就能做出来。后面选择干扰项的迷惑性也相当一般。所以，如果大家在考试中遇到这种水平的Section 2，一定要保证较高的正确率才可以。下面是具体每道题目的答案解析：
点击查看这篇
雅思听力
中需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
以及对应的
录音原文
：
剑桥雅思5 test 3 Section 2听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑5 test 3 section 2 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思5 Test3 Section2听力答案解析
第11题答案：C
对应原文：something that will certainly be of interest to you is that
Rexford is just 35 minutes from London Airport
.
答案解析：录音中提到校区离伦敦机场只有35分钟的距离。其实单单35分钟并不足以让我们判断选项C是正确答案，关键还在于前面的just，这样才能对应C中的near
第12题答案：E
对应原文：all our science and engineering research departments have unusually
close relationships with industry in the area
.
答案解析：industry在录音中原词出现，good links被替换为close relationships，因此判断E为正确答案。A选文章来自老烤鸭雅思项错在原文中并没有提到examination。B选项错在原文中只是说离市中心近，没有提到交通方式。D选项中的资金则完全没有提到。
第13题答案：references
对应原文：I mean occasionally there are postal problems, but most often the hold-up is caused by
references
答案解析：听到上一行的postal problems意识到答案即将到来。hold-up与delays同义替换，再加上词性方面的判断，由此确定答案为references。如果上面两点都没有反应过来的话，也可以通过单词重读来判断。
第14题答案：country
对应原文：is to put you in contact with, if possible, a student from your own
country
who is at present studying with us.
答案解析：听到student意识到答案即将出现，题干中的the same被替换为your own，虽然幅度有点大，但在该语境下基本表示相同的含义，因此确定答案为country
第15题答案：weather
对应原文：but important details like what the leisure facilities are like and whether the English
weather
and food are really as awful as everybody says!
答案解析：用上一行的Leisure facilities定位，空前词English直接原词出现，很容易确定答案为weather。
第16题答案：C
对应原文：you will be in an environment where
independent learning is the norm
答案解析：录音刚开始不就就提到了答案，容易反应不过来。原文中的norm被替换为expected，由此确定C是答案。原文中虽然提到了A选项的family，但并不是local；虽然提到了B选项的help，但并不是lecturers提供的。
第17题答案：C
对应原文：give priority in the allocation of residence places to three categories, and those are: visiting students, exchange students and
new postgraduate students
. However, demand exceeds supply
答案解析：读题的时候我们可以注意到这道题目的三个选项比较相似，差别只在前面的数量和后面的对象，因此可以将注意力放在这两方面。发现录音中只提到了C选项的new postgraduate students，由此确定答案。
第18题答案：A
对应原文： the good accommodation gets snapped up months before the beginning of term – in other words,
if you’re starting in October you need to be thinking about it in June or at the very latest July
.
答案解析：录音中先说了好的宿舍在学期开始前好几个月就会被抢光，然后又用具体的月份表示需要提前多久，因此答案为A。录音虽然确实提到了two or three weeks，但说的是不能等到这时候，因此排除。
第19题答案：B
对应原文：She’ll get in touch with you when you’re accepted – she’s got plenty of contacts in the town and
will deal with the agencies on your behalf
.
答案解析：这道题的关键在于对on somebody’s behalf这一短语的理解上。只要知道它是代表某人的意思，即可确定B为正确答案。
第20题答案：C
对应原文：
Some extra practice before you arrive is worth more
than.., for example, private lessons afterwards, when you won’t really have time
答案解析：选项A完全没有提到。选项B和C的差别主要在于是来之前练习英语，还是来之后练习英语。而原文中说的是来之前练习比到之后更有价值，因此确定答案为C。

剑桥雅思5 test 3 section 3听力原文与答案 Feedback Form
虽然这部分出了10道填空，与目前考试的整体趋势不太符合。但这一课程反馈场景却是现在经常考察的内容。其中出现的handout，outline等词汇更是大家一定要掌握的（
雅思备考听力篇 剑5 test 3 section 3 雅思听力高频词汇
）。
该部分的易错点主要是25题和29题。其中25
题很容易写成beginning，但它一方面不能跟in搭配，另一方面也不符合题目中too much这一条件（听力中说的是一开始作业太少）。因此得继续往后听，确定答案为second half。29题则是单纯的太过隐蔽，说完答案之后才提到too much，很容易反应不过来（
剑桥雅思5Test3听力Section3答案解析
）。
剑5 test 3 Section 3
雅思听力
原文
ANNIE: Oh Ben – I just remembered I never filled in that form for Nick – did you do it?
BEN: The course feedback form?
ANNIE: Yes. If you want, we can do it together, I’ve got mine here.
BEN: Is that OK?
ANNIE: Yeah.
BEN: OK, let’s have a look then. What do we have to do?
ANNIE: Let’s fill in the top first, let’s see, Course, Course code…
BEN: Er, it’s Communication in Business.
ANNIE: OK, Communication… in… Business, I do know that, but what’s the code?
BEN: CB 16 something, CB 162, isn’t it?
ANNIE: Mmm, that’s it, OK and dates, when did we start? I remember, my birthday’s on May 4th and it was the day after, it must have been
May 5th
.
Q21
BEN: Gosh, doesn’t seem that long ago, does it?
ANNIE: No, and we finish at the end of this week, on Friday, so that’s
July
15th?
BEN: Er
16th
, Monday was the 12th. Right, that was the easy bit, now let’s have a look – “Please give your comments on the following aspects of the course”, OK, what’s the first one? Oh, course organisation. What do you think?
Q22
ANNIE: Er, clear? It was, wasn’t it?
BEN: Yes, I think the organisation was
clear
. OK, anything else for course organisation?
Q23
ANNIE: It was a good thing he gave us
the course outline
at the beginning, in the first session, that was useful, so I’ll put that down, shall I? Now, going on to suggestion for improvement, one thing that wasn’t so good, I think we could have done a bit more work at the beginning, I mean at the beginning it seemed dead easy.
Q24
BEN: Yeah.
ANNIE: I thought it was going to be really easy and then all of a sudden in the
second half
of the course we got a whole load of work, reading to do and essays and things.
Q25
BEN: Yes, it’d be better if it was more even. OK, now course delivery, does that mean teaching?
ANNIE: Yeah, I suppose so. Well, what I thought was really good on this course was the
standard of teaching
. Actually – I mean some of the teachers were better than others – but the standard generally was fine. Much better than other courses I’ve been on.
Q26
BEN: Yeah, I agree. Let’s put that then. What about suggestions for improvement?
ANNIE: I… I didn’t think it was all that wonderful when we had great long
group discussion
sessions that went on for hours and hours. I don’t mean we shouldn’t have group discussions, just that they shouldn’t go on too long.
Q27
ANNIE: Now, on to materials and equipment.
BEN: Oh, now what was good about some sessions was the
handouts
.
Q28
ANNIE: Yes, I thought all the handouts were good actually, and some were great, with website addresses and everything.
BEN: One problem though with materials was the key texts.
ANNIE: Yes! There just weren’t enough copies on reserve in the library. And if you can’t get the key texts before the session, how are you supposed to do the reading? And not enough computers. You have to wait ages to get one.
BEN: OK, testing and evaluation – well, I don’t know, it’s hard to say until we’ve got our written assignments back.
ANNIE: Don’t talk about it, I only got mine in yesterday, it was a real struggle. I hate to think what mark I’ll get.
BEN: Yes, but at least we’ve done the oral presentation – I thought that was good, the way I got my feedback really quickly.
ANNIE: Yes, it was. And I liked the way we knew what we’d be evaluated on, we knew the criteria, so we knew we had to think about clarity, organisation, and so on.
BEN: Yeah, but I’m not so sure about the
written work
. One thing I think is that there’s just too much, it’s really stressful.
Q29
ANNIE: Yes, I’d agree and I don’t see why they can’t let us know the criteria they use for marking.
BEN: The written assignments? But he told us.
ANNIE: No, for the final exams. What are they looking for – what are the criteria? What makes a pass or a fail?
BEN: Yeah, I never thought of that. It’d be really useful.
ANNIE: OK, any other comments?
BEN: I thought
student support
was excellent.
Q30
ANNIE: Yeah, me too. OK, excellent. Other comments?
BEN: No, I can’t think of anything else.
ANNIE: Nor me. OK, so that’s done. Thanks, Ben.
BEN: No, thank you.

剑桥雅思5Test3听力Section3答案解析 Feedback Form
剑桥雅思5听力第三套题目的第三部分由10道表格填空题构成，整体难度不大。而且这种Section 3全部为填空的情况在最近几年的考试中十分少见，几乎每年都只有一次的样子。所以大家不要被它误解了。不过这部分出现了很多与课程反馈相关的场景单词，大家做完之后记得总结一下。
点击查看这篇
雅思听力
对应的
录音原文
与其中出现的需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思5 test 3 section 3听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑5 test 3 section 3 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思5 Test 3 Section 3听力答案解析
第21题答案：5th May
对应原文：when did we start? I remember, my birthday’s on May 4th and it was the day after, it must have been
May 5th
.
答案解析：录音中先给了5月4日的干扰项，但那是女性的生日，而非课程开始的日期。因此排除。后面又特意给了must这一提示，确定答案为May 5th（顺序无所谓）。
第22题答案：16th July/Friday 16th July
对应原文：ANNIE: No, and we finish at the end of this week, on Friday, so that’s
July
15th?
BEN: Er
16th
, Monday was the 12th.
答案解析：这道题采用他人更正的手法，而且男性说正确答案的时候还特意不带上月份，给大家设置障碍。这种将日期分成两段回答，或者前面干扰项是完整日期后面只说一半的情况还是比较常见的，大家多加注意。
第23题答案：clear/was clear
对应原文：Yes, I think the organisation was
clear
答案解析：这道题比较简单，题干中的organisation原词出现，而且clear还重复了两次（听力中多次重复的词很容易作为答案出现）。
第24题答案：(an/the) outline/(a/the) course outline
对应原文： It was a good thing he gave us
the course outline
at the beginning
答案解析：这道题的难点有两个，一是题干与原文的替换幅度比较大，对应起来不太容易。二是outline（提纲）一词有些同学不怎么熟悉，导致没听出来。但这个词是Section 3讨论论文时超级常见的词汇，所以务必要掌握。
第25题答案：(the) 2nd half
对应原文： I thought it was going to be really easy and then all of a sudden in the
second half
of the course we got a whole load of work
答案解析：录音中先以很清晰的语气说了at the beginning，部分同学就把它当作答案写了上去。但这里说的其实是开始的时候作业很少，不符合题干中的要求，因此排除。继续往下听，发现a whole load of work对应题干中的too much work，由此锁定second half。
第26题答案：(standard of) teaching/(standard of) teachers
对应原文：Well, what I thought was really good on this course was the
standard of teaching
答案解析：题目比较简单，提示词course delivery原词出现，而且standard和teaching还在原文中还反复提及，想忽略都难。
第27题答案：discussion/group discussion
对应原文：I… I didn’t think it was all that wonderful when we had great long
group discussion
sessions that went on for hours and hours.
答案解析：这道题的解题关键在于读题的时候就意识到题干末尾的too long是修饰答案的。这样一来，对录音中long之后的内容就会特别敏感。
第28题答案：handouts
对应原文：Oh, now what was good about some sessions was the
handouts
.
答案解析：与24题相似，这道题目的难度主要在于单词拼写。handout在听力中一般不表示传单，而是指任何分发的资料，也是Section 3比较常考的一个单词。
第29题答案：written work
对应原文： but I’m not so sure about the
written work
. One thing I think is that there’s just too much, it’s really stressful.
答案解析：这道题采用倒置的手法，先说答案，然后隔一小段再说提示词，比较考验大家的短期记忆能力。这种出题方式在填空题中已经算是比较难的了。目前7分以上的同学要注意一下。
第30题答案：student support/support for students
对应原文：I thought
student support
was excellent.
答案解析：题目比较简单，表格第一列的Other comments原词出现，而且excellent也紧跟着答案，很好确认位置。

剑桥雅思5 test 3 section 4听力原文与答案 household waste recycling
这篇Section 4虽然由10道填空题构成，但并不是现在比较流行的提纲型填空题，而是单句填空和表格填空。相比较而言，后两者的难度要大于前者，尤其是在定位句子方面。单句填空和表格填空因为没有太过明显的定位词，很容易漏掉。
该部分的易错点主要是32题和36题。前者主要难在incineration的拼写上。而后者则由不少同学把roads听成了rose。
点击查看这篇雅思听力对应的
答案解析
以及需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
剑桥雅思5Test3听力Section4答案解析
雅思备考听力篇 剑5 test 3 section 4 雅思听力高频词汇
剑5 test 3 Section 4
雅思听力
原文
STUDENT: Well, my group has been doing a project on how household waste is recycled in Britain.
We were quite shocked to discover that only 9% of people here in the UK make an effort to recycle their household waste. This is a lower figure than in most other European countries, and needs to increase dramatically in the next few years if the government is going to meet its recycling targets.
The agreed targets for the UK mean that by 2008 we must reduce our carbon dioxide emissions by
12.5%
, compared with 1990. And recycling can help to achieve that goal, in two main ways: the production of recycled glass and paper uses much less energy than producing them from virgin materials, and also recycling reduces greenhouse gas emissions from landfill sites and
incineration plants
.
Q31/Q32
As part of our project, we carried out a survey of people in the street, and the thing that came up over and over again is that people don’t think it’s easy enough to recycle their waste. One problem is that there aren’t enough ‘
drop-off
’ sites, that is, the places where the public are supposed to take their waste.
Q33
We also discovered that waste that’s collected from householders is taken to places called ‘bring banks’, for sorting and baling into loads. One problem here is taking out everything that shouldn’t have been placed in the recycling containers: people put all sorts of things into bottle banks, like plastic bags and even broken umbrellas. All this has to be removed by hand. Another difficulty is that toughened glass used for
cooking
doesn’t fully melt at the temperature required for other glass, and so that also has to be picked out by hand.
Q34
Glass is easy to recycle because it can be reused over and over again without becoming weaker. Two million tons of glass is thrown away each year, that is, seven billion bottles and jars; but only
500,000
tons of that is collected and recycled.
Q35
Oddly enough, half the glass that’s collected is green, and a lot of that is imported, so more green glass is recycled than the UK needs. As a result, new uses are being developed for recycled glass, particularly green glass, for example in fibreglass manufacture and water filtration. A company called CLF Aggregates makes a product for
roads
, and 30% of the material is crushed glass.
Q36
For recycling paper, Britain comes second in Europe with 40%, behind Germany’s amazing 70%.
When recycling started, there were quality problems, so it was difficult to use recycled paper in office printers. But these problems have now been solved, and Martin’s, based in South London, produces a range of office stationery which is 100% recycled, costs the same as normal paper and is of equally high quality.
But this high quality comes at a cost in terms of the waste produced during the process. Over a third of the waste paper that comes in can’t be used in the recycled paper, leaving the question of what to do with it. One firm, Papersave, currently sells this to farmers as a
soil conditioner
, though this practice will soon be banned because of transport costs and the smell, and the company is looking into the possibility of alternative uses.
Q37
Plastic causes problems, because there are so many different types of plastic in use today, and each one has to be dealt with differently. Pacrite recycles all sorts of things, from bottles to car bumpers, and one of its most successful activities is recycling plastic bottles to make
containers
which are used all over the country to collect waste.
Q38
The Save-a-Cup scheme was set up by the vending and plastics industries to recycle as many as possible of the three-and-a-half billion polystyrene cups used each year. At the moment 500 million polycups are collected, processed and sold on to other businesses, such as Waterford, which turns the cups into
pencils
, and Johnson & Jones, a Welsh-based firm, which has developed a wide variety of items, including
business cards
.
Q39, Q40
Well, to sum up, there seems to be plenty of research going on into how to re-use materials, but the biggest problem is getting people to think about recycling instead of throwing things away. At least doing the research made us much more careful.
剑5 test 3 Section 4雅思听力答案
31. 12.5%
32. incineration plants
33. drop-off
34. cooking
35. 500,000
36. roads
37. soil conditioner
38. containers
39. pencils
40. business cards

剑桥雅思5Test3听力Section4答案解析 household waste recycling
剑桥雅思5第三套题目听力第四部分由5道单句填空和5道表格填空组成。文段主题和题目难度都跟现在考试的情况比较接近。唯一一点瑕疵在于现在雅思听力考试的Section 4一般以提纲型填空为主（有明确的小标题和分论点），表格和单句填空见得比较少一些。不过做题方法上并没有太大的差别。大家做完之后可以对照雅思
听力评分标准
，看看自己目前水平如何。
点击查看这篇
雅思听力
对应的
录音原文
与需要大家掌握的
高频词汇
：
剑桥雅思5 test 3 section 4听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑5 test 3 section 4 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思5 Test 3 Section 4听力答案解析
第31题答案：12.5%
对应原文：The agreed targets for the UK mean that by 2008 we must reduce our carbon dioxide emissions by
12.5%
答案解析：虽然这道题我们很难事先根据题干判断出空上应该填一个百分比，但2008年提示相当明显，再加上lower与reduce的同义替换，以及12.5%的重读，确定答案并不是很困难。
第32题答案：incineration plants
对应原文：also recycling reduces greenhouse gas emissions from landfill sites and
incineration plants
.
答案解析：题干上空与landfill sites并列，因此我们听的时候要注意寻找并列关系。这道题中并没有在这一点上设置障碍，很容易就可以找到答案。其难度主要在incineration这个单词的拼写上。
第33题答案：drop-off
对应原文：One problem is that there aren’t enough ‘
drop-off
’ sites, that is, the places where the public are supposed to take their waste.
答案解析：听到problem意识到答案即将出现，a lack of与not enough同义替换，sites原词出现，很容易锁定答案位置。难点在于drop-off出现了浊化（/p/发/b/的音）与连读，部分同学可能听到之后识别不出来对应的具体词汇。
第34题答案：cooking
对应原文：Another difficulty is that toughened glass used for
cooking
doesn’t fully melt at the temperature required for other glass
答案解析：听到glass意识到答案已经不远，根据utilised与used的同义替换很容易锁定答案位置，cooking的拼写也比较简单。这道题只要跟上录音节奏就不存在什么困难。
第35题答案：500,000
对应原文：Two million tons of glass is thrown away each year, that is, seven billion bottles and jars; but only
500,000
tons of that is collected and recycled.
答案解析：根据题干可以事先判断空上填的应该是数字。录音中先说了2 million，又说了7 billion，但它们都不符合题干中recycled这一条件，因此排除之后继续往下，确定500000为答案。
第36题答案：roads
对应原文：A company called CLF Aggregates makes a product for
roads
答案解析：听到前一单元格内CLF Aggregates的公司名称意识到答案即将出现，roads读的很重，比较容易确定答案。
第37题答案：soil conditioner
对应原文：One firm, Papersave, currently sells this to farmers as a
soil conditioner
答案解析：解题思路跟上一道题一样，根据公司名称定位，根据重音确定答案。不过相比于上道题来说，这道题在两个地方增加了难度。一是中间废话很多，如果注意力不集中的话可能会漏掉Papersave这一提示词。二是soil conditioner这一短语比较少见，可能会反应不过来。
第38题答案：containers
对应原文：Pacrite recycles all sorts of things, from bottles to car bumpers, and one of its most successful activities is recycling plastic bottles to make
containers
which are used all over the country to collect waste.
答案解析：相比于前几道题目来说，提示词Pacrite与答案相距较远，很容易让人觉得自己是不是已经漏了过去。不过我们可以根据表头推测空上填的肯定是种产品，而make又正好跟表头上的manufacture同义替换，由此锁定答案。
第39题答案：pencils
对应原文： such as Waterford, which turns the cups into
pencils
答案解析：唯一的难点在于跟上一道题目之间插入了很多废话，但只要耐心等待waterford就不难做。
第40题答案：business card
对应原文：Johnson & Jones, a Welsh-based firm, which has developed a wide variety of items, including
business cards
答案解析：与之前题目类似，根据公司名称Johnsone & Jones定位到答案所在句子，根据重读和表头确定答案。但这道题跟上道题距离较近，如果在pencils上耽误一会儿的话，可能会漏掉。

剑桥雅思5 test 4 section 1听力原文与答案 host family applicant
这篇Section 1的听力题目非常典型，不仅内容是雅思听力中十分喜爱的租房场景（
雅思备考听力篇 剑5 test 4 section 1 雅思听力高频词汇
），而且出题方式上也基本涵盖了Section 1所有的干扰项类型。大家做完之后一定要记着多琢磨琢磨，然后再做做
精听
，以便将题目的作用最大化。
易错点主要是第3题。虽然录音中女生明显是想要强调她只能在这里待4个月，但题目问的是intended，也就是想要待多久。这点跟原文中的plan对应，因此确定答案是1 year。这道题也最好地说明了雅思听力的出题方式其实更加注重题目，而非原文的特点。
点击查看这篇雅思听力具体题目的
答案解析
：
剑桥雅思5Test4听力Section1答案解析
剑5 test 4 Section 1
雅思听力
原文
ADVISER: Good morning, how can I help you?
STUDENT: Good morning. Umm, I understand you help fix up students with host families.
ADVISER: That’s right… are you interested in…?
STUDENT: Yes…
ADVISER: Well please sit down and I’ll just take a few details.
STUDENT: Thank you.
ADVISER: Right now… what name is it?
STUDENT: Jenny Chan.
ADVISER: Can you spell that please?
STUDENT: Yes…
J-E-N-N-Y C-H-A-N
.
Example
ADVISER: Right… and what is your present address?
STUDENT: Sea View Guest House,
14 Hill Road
.
Q1
ADVISER: OK, and do you know the phone number there?
STUDENT: Yes… I have it here, ummm… 2237676, but I’m only there after about 7 pm.
ADVISER: So when would be the best time to catch you?
STUDENT: I suppose
between 9 and, let me see, half-past
, before I leave for the college.
Q2
ADVISER: Great… and can I ask you your age?
STUDENT: I’ve just had my nineteenth birthday.
ADVISER: And how long would you want to stay with the host family?
STUDENT: I’m planning on staying
a year
but at the moment I’m definitely here for four months only. I have to get an extension to my permit.
Q3
ADVISER: You’re working on it? Fine… and what will be your occupation while you’re in the UK?
STUDENT: Studying English?
ADVISER: And what would you say your level of English is?
STUDENT: Umm. Good, I think I’d like to say ‘advanced’ but my written work is below the level of my spoken, so I suppose it’s
intermediate
.
Q4
ADVISER: Certainly your spoken English is advanced. Anyway, which area do you think you would prefer?
STUDENT: Ummm, well I’m studying right in the centre but I’d really like to live in the
north-west
.
Q5
ADVISER: That shouldn’t be a great problem… we usually have lots of families up there.
ADVISER: And do you have any particular requirements for diet?
STUDENT: Well, I’m nearly a
vegetarian
… not quite.
Q6
ADVISER: Shall I say you are? It’s probably easier that way.
STUDENT: That would be best.
ADVISER: Anything about your actual room?
STUDENT: I would prefer my own facilities – ‘en suite’, is that right? And also if it’s possible a TV and I’d also like the house to have a real
garden
rather than just a yard, somewhere I could sit and be peaceful.
Q7
ADVISER: Is that all?
STUDENT: Well… I’m really serious about improving my English so I’d prefer to be
the only guest
if that’s possible?
Q8
ADVISER: No other guests… Yes, you get more practice that way. Anyway, obviously all this is partly dependent on how much you’re willing to pay. What did you have in mind?
STUDENT: I was thinking in terms of about ￡60-￡80 a week, but I’d go up to
a hundred
if it was something special.
Q9
ADVISER: Well I don’t think we’d have any problems finding something for you.
STUDENT: Oh, good.
ADVISER: And when would you want it for?
STUDENT: I’d like to move in approximately two weeks.
ADVISER: Let me see, it’s the 10th today… so if we go for the
Monday
it’s the
23rd March
.
Q10
STUDENT: Yes.
ADVISER: Right… good, and if I could ask one last question…
剑5 test 4 Section 1雅思听力答案
1. 14 Hill Road
2. between 9 and 9.30/9-9.30
3. 1 year
4. intermediate
5. Northwest
6. vegetarian
7. (a) (real) garden
8. (the) only guest
9. 100
10. 23rd March/Monday 23rd March

内容:
剑桥雅思5Test4听力Section1答案解析 host family applicant
剑桥雅思5第四套题目听力第一部分是道非常经典的Section 1。一方面，其场景为现在雅思听力考试仍然十分青睐的租房场景；另一方面，它又涉及到这部分比较具有迷惑性的干扰项。所以大家做完之后一定要好好分析一下其出题方式和思路，做到有备无患。下面是具体每道题目的答案解析。
点击查看这篇
雅思听力
对应的
录音原文
与其中出现的需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思5 test 4 section 1听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑5 test 4 section 1 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思5 Test 4 Section 1听力答案解析
第1题答案：14 Hill Road
对应原文：Sea View Guest House,
14 Hill Road
.
答案解析：题目本身没有难度，有些同学可能会把14听成40，或者因为hill road读的稍快听成了hero road。如果出现这两种情况，说明大家的听音辨音能力不够，要多做
精听
才行。
第2题答案：between 9 and 9.30/9-3.30
对应原文：I suppose
between 9 and, let me see, half-past
, before I leave for the college.
答案解析：这道题目的难点在于后面的half-past省略了nine，导致不少同学听到之后都比较迷茫，要么只写了前面的9，要么只写了9.30。不过现在雅思听力考试中如果考察时间段，题干一般都是from ___ to ____或者between ____ and ____的格式，可以实现进行实现推测。
第3题答案：1 year
对应原文：I’m planning on staying
a year
but at the moment I’m definitely here for four months only.
答案解析：这道题的错误率最高，虽然女文章来自老烤鸭雅思性的回答中确实更加强调她现在只能在这里待四个月，但题干上问的是打算待多久，与原文中planning对应，所以答案是a year才对。
第4题答案：intermediate
对应原文：Umm. Good, I think I’d like to say ‘advanced’ but my written work is below the level of my spoken, so I suppose it’s
intermediate
.
答案解析：这道题虽然出现了自我更正，先说advanced，然后给了解释，最后才说整体情况。但大部分同学都能找到intermediate这一答案。难点主要在拼写上。
第5题答案：North-west
对应原文：Ummm, well I’m studying right in the centre but I’d really like to live in the
north-west
.
答案解析：前面center的干扰项比较明显，大多数同学都不会上当。north-west写成northwest或者north west都可以，大不大写也都可以。
第6题答案：vegetarian
对应原文：Well, I’m nearly a
vegetarian
答案解析：只要在租房场景中提到饮食要求，答案百分之八十以上都是vegetarian（素食主义者），所以大家务必要熟练掌握这个单词的拼写。
第7题答案：(a) (real) garden
对应原文：And also if it’s possible a TV and I’d also like the house to have a real
garden
rather than just a yard
答案解析：答案与TV并列，本身拼写也很简单，唯一需要注意的就是rather than表否定，别把yard写上去就行。
第8题答案：(the) only guest
对应原文：I’m really serious about improving my English so I’d prefer to be
the only guest
if that’s possible?
答案解析：一些同学可能会因为心急，把上文的peaceful当成答案写了上去。但peaceful其实是修饰garden的，不存在并列关系，因此排除。
第9题答案：100
对应原文：I was thinking in terms of about ￡60-￡80 a week, but I’d go up to
a hundred
if it was something special.
答案解析：不少同学容易受前面60和80的干扰。这里有两个小技巧可以帮忙，一是but之后的内容是答案的可能性要远高于but之前，二是题干上有maximum的限定条件，正确答案前面必须要有对应的词汇才可以。
第10题答案：23rd March/Monday 23rd March
对应原文：Let me see, it’s the 10th today… so if we go for the
Monday
it’s the
23rd March
答案解析：正常考察日期，没有什么难度。23rd的rd带不带都行。日期顺序也可以进行调整，March 23rd同样正确。

内容:
剑桥雅思5 test 4 Section 2听力原文与答案
这篇雅思听力Section 2是比较典型的组织介绍场景，也是现在雅思听力比较喜欢考察的四大场景之一。不过题型上出现了大量的表格，而表格现在已经失去了剑桥雅思考试委员会的宠爱，在最近几年出现的频率不高。
容易出错的地方主要是第12题和第19题。前者的同义替换比较隐蔽，用begin with代替first，而且离上一道题目很近，非常容易漏过去。后者则是单纯的单词问题，不少同学不太清楚newsletter（简讯，内部通讯）是什么意思，犹犹豫豫没敢写，最后只能空着。
点击查看这篇雅思听力对应的
答案解析
与需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思5Test4听力Section2答案解析
雅思备考听力篇 剑5 test 4 section 2 雅思听力高频词汇
剑5 test 4 Section 2
雅思听力
原文
Good evening everyone and thank you for coming to the Soccer Club meeting. It’s good to see so many parents and children here tonight, and I know you are looking forward to a great football season. Now I’d like to take a few minutes to tell you about some changes to the Soccer Club for the coming season.
Now, this season we’ll be playing all our matches for both the junior and senior competitions at King’s Park, instead of Royal Park, which was used last season.
Now for meetings, we’re going to use the
clubhouse
in King’s Park, and the next meeting will be held in the clubhouse on the 2nd of July.
Q11
As usual, we hope to begin the season with a
picnic
next Saturday at the clubhouse. Please try and come to the picnic as it’s always good fun. The last week of the season we usually have a dinner and presentation of
prizes
to the players, and more information about this will be given to you later in the season.
Q12, Q13
This season we have more teams than ever. We hope to have
ten
teams, instead of five, in the junior competition and they will play on Saturday mornings, beginning at 8.30 a. m. Training sessions will be held in King’s Park on
Wednesday afternoons
for the juniors and they will be wearing red shirts again this year.
Q14, Q15
In the senior competition, there’ll be
four
teams, the same as last year, and their games will be played on Saturday afternoons starting at 2.30, no sorry, it will be a 2 o’clock start, and the training session for seniors is planned for
Sunday afternoons
.
Q16, Q17
Now I’d like to introduce you to the new committee for the Soccer Club for this season. Firstly, let me welcome Robert Young, the new President, who will manage the meetings for the next two years. Robert’s son has been playing football with the club for over five years now, and many thanks to Robert for taking on the job of President.
Next we have Gina Costello, she’s the treasurer, and she will
collect the fees
from you for the season. Please try and give Gina your fees as early as possible in the season, as the club needs the money to buy some new equipment.
Q18
Then there’s David West who has volunteered to be the club secretary, and one of the many jobs he will have is to
send out newsletters
to you regularly. If you have any information that may be useful, please let David know so that it can be included in these newsletters.
Q19
Also I’d like to introduce you to Jason Dokic who is the Head Coach. For all the new members here tonight, this is the third year that Jason has been with us as Head Coach, and we are very lucky to have such an experienced coach and former player at our club. He will continue to
supervise the teams
, at training sessions and on match days.
Q20
Now before we finish and have some refreshments, does anyone have any questions they’d like to ask the new committee?
剑5 test 4 Section 1雅思听力答案
11. clubhouse
12. picnic
13. prizes
14. 10
15. Wednesday afternoon(s)
16. 4
17. Sunday afternoon(s)
18. collect (the) fees/collect (the) money
19. send (out) newsletter(s)
20. supervise (the) team

内容:
剑桥雅思5Test4听力Section2答案解析 独家
剑桥雅思5听力第四套题目第二部分由3道单句填空和7道表格填空构成。题目与题目之间难度差异很大，前面的单句填空比较难，中间14-17的表格相当简单，最后的3道表格又会比较难一些。相信大家在做题的时候心情也会跟过山车一样，时上时下的。下面是具体每一道题目的答案解析，以供参考。
点击查看这篇
雅思听力
对应的
录音原文
与需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思5 test 4 Section 2听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑5 test 4 section 2 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思5 Test 4 Section 2听力答案解析
第11题答案：clubhouse
对应原文：Now for meetings, we’re going to use the
clubhouse
in King’s Park, and the next meeting will be held in the clubhouse on the 2nd of July.
答案解析：第1题难度不大，meetings提到答案即将到来，句子里除了clubhouse之外，其他名词都已经在题干上出现，很容易锁定答案。
第12题答案：picnic
对应原文：As usual, we hope to begin the season with a
picnic
next Saturday at the clubhouse
答案解析：这道题目的难点在于没有明显的提示词告知大家答案即将到来。虽然begin with与first的替换很容易识别，但因为不容易确定答案所在句子，所以容易漏过。
第13题答案：prizes
对应原文：The last week of the season we usually have a dinner and presentation of
prizes
to the players
答案解析：这道题采用了语序颠倒的出题手法。题干上问的是运文章来自老烤鸭雅思动员会收到什么，原文则给替换成会给运动员什么，猛地听起来会有些发懵。除此之外，录音中presentation读的很重，部分同学可能把它当作答案。但填上去之后与句义不符，只能排除。
第14题答案：10
对应原文：We hope to have
ten
teams
答案解析：根据题干可以推断出空上应该填个数字，直接听就可以了。
第15题答案：Wednesday afternoon(s)
对应原文：Training sessions will be held in King’s Park on
Wednesday afternoons
for the juniors
答案解析：虽然事先很难根据题干推测空上大致应该填什么内容。但录音中直接提到了表头training sessions作为提示，所以答案并不难找。
第16题答案：4
对应原文：In the senior competition, there’ll be
four
teams
答案解析：与第16题类似，事先推断空上填的是数字，然后注意录音中出现的数字即可。
第17题答案：Sunday afternoon(s)
对应原文：the training session for seniors is planned for
Sunday afternoons
答案解析：同第15题。
第18题答案：collect (the) fees/collect (the) money
对应原文：Next we have Gina Costello, she’s the treasurer, and she will
collect the fees
from you for the season
答案解析：根据表头的responsibility以及上一行的to manage meetings，我们可以推断出空上应该填的是某种职责。录音中先说了Gina Costello这一名字作为提示，随后认真听她负责的事项即可。
第19题答案：send (out) (the) newsletter(s)
对应原文：Then there’s David West who has volunteered to be the club secretary, and one of the many jobs he will have is to
send out newsletters
to you regularly
答案解析：与上一道题目类似，也是人名作为提示，然后重点听职责。不过相比于上一道题目相比，这道题答案里的newsletters（内部通讯，简讯）很多同学不太熟悉，导致虽然听到了答案，但没写出来。
第20题答案：supervise (the) teams
对应原文：He will continue to
supervise the teams
, at training sessions and on match days
答案解析：与之前题目相比，这道题稍微增加了点难度。录音中说完人名之后加了一句解释的话，然后才轮到答案所在的句子。部分同学可能觉得中间那句话里有答案，一直在努力回忆，反而错过了后面的句子。

剑桥雅思5 test 4 section 3听力原文与答案
这篇雅思听力Section 3由一位老师和两名同学一起讨论某个公司构成，正好是目前Section 3的主流出题趋势。题目方面，前面的四道填空稍微偏简单一些，后面的选择和匹配都比较符合现在的考试难度。尤其是第25题和第26题将考察重点放在人名和观点的匹配上，是听力Section 3独有的考察套路，大家可以稍加注意一下。
点击查看这篇雅思听力对应的题目
答案解析
与需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思5Test4听力Section3答案解析
雅思备考听力篇 剑5 test 4 section 3 雅思听力高频词汇
剑5 test 4 Section 3
雅思听力
原文
TUTOR: Right, Jason and Karin, now I asked you to look at the case study for Box Telecom as part of your exam assessment. It’s interesting because they are in the middle of problems at the moment and I want you to track how they deal with them. Let’s start with you, Karin. Having read through the case study, can you just summarise what the problems were that Box Telecom had to take on board?
KARIN: Um, yeah… Well of course what first came to their attention was that, despite a new advertising campaign, they were suffering from falling
sales
– and this is something that had many causes. On top of that immediate problem, what had also happened over the last two years was that, although they had invested in an expansion plan, they had to face up to increased
competition
. And, before they had a chance to get to grips with the effects of that, they were stalled by a strike and it was just when they were thinking about making a colossal investment in new machinery for their plants. So they were really in trouble.
Q21, Q22
TUTOR: Yes, I think that’s fair. And Jason, you contacted the company, didn’t you?What did the company define as the reasons for these problems?
JASON: Well, I think they’ve hit on the right things – it would be easy to say they had invested too heavily, or at the wrong time, but in fact the signs were good and what they were set back by was high
interest rates
. At the same time, their longer-term problems, which were affecting their market share, were eventually credited to poor
training
– and having looked at the details in their last report I think that’s right.
Q23, Q24
TUTOR: So, onto the larger issues then. Karin, what do you think the company will do?
KARIN: Hmm… Well, obviously they have the choice of accepting the very favourable terms that another company – KMG Plc- have given them to buy them out. That would mean creating a new company with a new image. Or they could decide on a bolder move and offer some new shares if they wanted. But I think they’re much more cautious than that and expect they will start
trying to find individuals who’d be prepared to back them with some of the capital they need
.
Q25
TUTOR: Well, you mustn’t always assume that dramatic problems require dramatic solutions. Sometimes there’s a simple fix such as changing the guy at the top. If they truly are cautious, then I suspect they will seek to shut down some of their shops. But a more ambitious approach, and one which I think would have more chance of success, would be to
alter how they’re running things
– the management layers and the processes. So in your analysis try to think of all the options. Jason?
Q26
JASON: Yes, it’s interesting because I’ve found it a really useful company to study. Its problems cross all types of industries and it’s lucky it’s so big – a smaller or even medium-sized company would have gone under by now.
TUTOR: Ah well in fact, what I want you two to do is to go away when we’ve finished our discussion today and write a report. We’ve looked in general at the telecommunications market in the UK over the last few sessions and I want you to take Box Telecom as an example and
suggest some ways in which they might overcome their problems
. And outline the reasons why you think as you do – but try and keep it intrinsic to the company rather than dragging in other examples. Is that OK, Karin?
Q27
KARIN: Yes, I think I can do that. Personally I’ve got great hopes for it.
I think it will recover
. That advertising campaign they did was very strong and they’re very innovative with their products – they set new trends. The company’s got to recover, don’t you think, Jason?
Q28
JASON: Hmmm – I’m not sure. I think it can but it’s not a foregone conclusion unless they manage
to attract the right level of investment
. The company definitely needs a boost
and to attract more highly skilled workers if their recovery is to be long-lasting. When I was talking to the marketing manager he said to me that he thinks the company had got a great management team – but he would say that, wouldn’t he? – but they are suffering from having to work with outdated production machinery and that could cost a lot to put right.
Q29
TUTOR: Well, personally I think the stock market is to blame. I think they were expecting too much of the company and then inevitably it looked bad when it didn’t perform. The market should have had more realistic expectations.
And I disagree with you about the advertising campaign Karin. That’s where they could do with some innovation
– to get sales kick-started. Anyway, let’s see what you come up with… [fade]
Q30
剑5 test 4 Section 3雅思听力答案

22. competition
23. interest rates/rates of interest
24. training
25. A
26. B
27. A
28. C
29. B

内容:
剑桥雅思5Test4听力Section3答案解析 独家
剑桥雅思5听力第四套题目的第三部分由4道笔记填空，3道单项选择，以及3道人名观点匹配题组成。难度逐渐增加。到最后的匹配题时不仅用上了最难的句义替换，而且还设置了干扰项。所以后半部分做的不太好的同学也不用伤心。下面是具体每道题目的答案解析。
点击查看这篇
雅思听力
对应的
录音原文
与其中出现的需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思5 test 4 section 3听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑5 test 4 section 3 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思5 Test 4 Section 3听力答案解析
第21题答案：sales
对应原文：Well of course what first came to their attention was that, despite a new advertising campaign, they were suffering from falling
sales
答案解析：题干上虽然没有明显的提示词，但录音中用了first提示大家第一题即将到来。falling与题干中的drop同义替换，由此确定答案为sales。
第22题答案：competition
对应原文：On top of that immediate problem … although they had invested in an expansion plan, they had to face up to increased
competition
.
答案解析：听到on top of这一连接词意识到第一点已经结束，进入第二点。空前词growing与increased同义替换，因此确定答案为competition。
第23题答案：interest rates/rate of interest
对应原文：But in fact the signs were good and what they were set back by was high
interest rates
.
答案解析：男性说完之后，轮到女性发言，进入笔记填空的下半部分。空前词high原词出现，很容易确定答案为interest rates。不过这里interest并不是兴趣的意思，而是表示利息，interest rates合起来就是利率。
第24题答案：training
对应原文：At the same time, their longer-term problems, which were affecting their market share, were eventually credited to poor
training
答案解析：听到at the same time这一连接词，意识到23题结束，进入24题。空前词lack of good被替换成了poor。除此之外，training读的也比较重，由此确定答案。
第25题答案：A
对应原文：But I think they’re much more cautious than that and expect they will start
trying to find individuals who’d be prepared to back them with some of the capital they need
.
答案解析：录音中先提到了其他公司的收购意向（对应B选项），和发行新的股份（C选项）。但随后跟了个but，表示后面说的才是其真正的意思。原文中的individuals被替换为private，capital被替换为investors，由此确定答案。
第26题答案：B
对应原文：But a more ambitious approach, and one which I think would have more chance of success, would be to
alter how they’re running things
答案解析：出题方式与上一题一样。先提到更换顶层领导（对应A选项）和关闭一些门店（对应C选项），最后同样是使用but表示转折，然后跟正确答案。原文中的how被替换为way，alter被替换为change，running被替换为organise，由此确定答案。
第27题答案：A
对应原文： I want you to take Box Telecom as an example and
suggest some ways in which they might overcome their problems
.
答案解析：这道题比较简单，干扰项只是提到录音中零星的词汇，吸引力不大。选项中的solution基本概括了原文所表达的含义，因此确定答案为A
第28题答案：C
对应原文：Personally I’ve got great hopes for it.
I think it will recover
.
答案解析：虽然女生在后面又说了很多内容，但其实一开始就表明了自己的立场：该公司会恢复的，对应C选项中的克服困难。后面的东西只是支持自己看法的论据而已。
第29题答案：B
对应原文：I’m not sure. I think it can but it’s not a foregone conclusion unless they manage
to attract the right level of investment
. The company definitely needs a boost
答案解析：与上一道题目一样，男性一开始就说了自己的观点。如果只听到这里的话比较容易确定B是答案。但后面他又说了很多东西，不少同学以为这里面才有答案，反而因为没绕明白而不知道该选哪个。
第30题答案：D
对应原文：
And I disagree with you about the advertising campaign Karin. That’s where they could do with some innovation
答案解析：老师的观点需要结合女生的观点来看。女生之前提到他们的市场营销策略还不错。但老师说这点我不同意，他们需要在这方面进行更多的创新。对应D选项中的市场营销活动需要提升。因此确定答案。

内容:
剑桥雅思5 test 4 Section 4听力原文与答案
这篇雅思听力Section 4由比较反人类的
选择题和匹配题
构成。通常来说，相比于前面几部分的选择和匹配，Section 4会在同义替换上下更大的功夫，尤其喜欢词义解释和句子替换这种需要完全理解文章内容才能够作对的出题方式。所以如果大家在考场上遇到这种出题组合，基本就可以考虑报名下一场了。不过，好消息是选择题和匹配题在Section 4一直都比较少见。去年50场雅思考试中只有4场出现了这两种题型，而且还只是作为填空题的补充，所以也不必太过担心。
场景方面，这篇文章介绍了某个图书馆的各项设施和服务，属于雅思听力比较喜欢考察的内容。大家做完之后可以总结下相关词汇，以防下次在考试中遇到。
雅思备考听力篇 剑5 test 4 section 4 雅思听力高频词汇
点击查看这篇雅思听力对应的答案解析：
剑桥雅思5Test4听力Section4答案解析
剑5 test 4 Section 4
雅思听力
原文
OK, are you all settled? Well, first of all, welcome to Cardiff University. I’m here to explain what we can offer you.
Now, as a new student at the university, you will probably need some sort of guidance to help you to use the library effectively to study and research. Some of you have asked about a guided tour but we find this rather muddles people. So,
in this first week, we run a series of talks which focus on different aspects of the library and its resources
. You’ll also find that to get the most out of the library you really do need to be computer literate and so all this term we run small classes which will bring you up to speed on how to access the computer-loaded information.
Q31
OK, now let me give you an outline of what’s available to you. You’ll find that the computers are increasingly used as a research tool. Many students do most of their research on the internet and the library computers are permanently online. Having found what you need, you’ll find you can readily save texts on your personal computer space to print off when you need. You might think that it is the fastest way to get information but the links can be slow.
Clearly you can find lots on there but much of it is useless information as it is from highly debatable sources
– so be critical. You’ll also find that the library has loaded several CD-ROMS onto the computers from specialist reference sources such as the MLA. It means we can expand what we offer you
at very little extra cost
and saves us having to invest in more and more books. The CD-ROMS contain exactly the same information as the reference books as the two are updated together.
Q32, Q33
Now most of you will need to refer to journal articles in your work and you’ll find you can also access these online and we encourage you to do so.
Clearly some of you will find the printed version more accessible as it sits on the shelves but I’m afraid the intention is to phase these out eventually
. However, you will still be able to print off a version of the text rather than photocopying the journal pages. So you must get used to working online. Naturally we do still have the full range of classic reference books, additional to the CD-ROMS, for you to use and there are several copies of each one. This is because
some of you may prefer to borrow a book rather than sit in the library
. There is a restricted loan time on these so that they are not missing from the shelves for too long. Although there is a Section Manager for each part of the library, they are very busy and so, if you do get stuck looking for things, you should ask the relevant Cataloguing Assistant. As your Training Supervisor,
I just oversee your induction
and will not be around after this initial week.
Q34, Q35, Q36
Some of you may be interested to know that the library is offering specialised training sessions on writing a dissertation. Obviously this is not relevant to those of you who are undergraduates; it is just for postgraduates. Your department will discuss the planning stage of the dissertation – i.e. what you’re going to do – with you and we will focus on the structure of it. However,
the training will also include some time on the computers
. I realise most of you know how to organise files but we can show you the
different ways to run data programmes
. Your tutors will tell you at the outset how to set out the chapters they require but you will need to
ask them how they would like you to organise the bibliography
because it varies depending on your subject area.
When you’ve got something together the trainer here will look through the draft version for you to see if it’s OK
. And, one final point, for those of you who have registered from abroad, we can offer individual sessions on dissertations if you feel you need them.
If you require language lessons then they are available from the International Centre next to the Law Department
.
Q37, Q38, Q39, Q40
剑5 test 4 Section 4雅思听力答案
31. B   32. A   33. A   34. C   35. A
36. B   37. B   38. A   39. B   40. C

剑桥雅思5Test4听力Section4答案解析 独家
剑桥雅思5听力第四套题目第四部分的10道题由6道单项选择和4道匹配构成。难度在整个剑桥雅思系列书籍中也算是数一数二的了。不过大家可以放心的是，这种题型组合在现在的听力考试中十分少见。一年48-50场考试里最多也就出现两次，一般都是一次都没有。下面是具体每道题目的答案解析。
点击查看这篇
雅思听力
对应的
录音原文
与需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思5 test 4 Section 4听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑5 test 4 section 4 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思5 Test 4 Section 4听力答案解析
第31题答案：B
对应原文：So,
in this first week, we run a series of talks which focus on different aspects of the library and its resources
答案解析：原文中提到了guided tour对应选项A，但后面紧接着就说了But，觉得会打扰到别人，因此排除。原文中也确实提到了computer和course，但说的是在这一学期里，而非第一周，因此同样排除。B选项中的listen to descriptions与原文中的talks对应，由此确定答案。
第32题答案：A
对应原文：
Clearly you can find lots on there but much of it is useless information as it is from highly debatable sources
– so be critical.
答案解析：选项B和选项C都没有提到。A选项的unreliable虽然没有直接的同义替换词，但录音中说到互联网上的信息可能来自有争议的地方，所以要有批判性地看待。即表示其不可靠的意思，因此确定答案为A。
第33题答案：A
对应原文：It means we can expand what we offer you
at very little extra cost
and saves us having to invest in more and more books.
答案解析：B选项完全没有提到。C选项则错在CD跟图书资源是一起更新的，并不比图书快。原文中的little cost在选项A里被替换为cheap，由此确定答案。
第34题答案：C
对应原文：
Clearly some of you will find the printed version more accessible as it sits on the shelves but I’m afraid the intention is to phase these out eventually
.
答案解析：这道题的关键在于对录音中phase out这一短语理解。它表文章来自老烤鸭雅思示逐渐消失，消除的意思。由此对应C选项中的reduced，确定答案。
第35题答案：A
对应原文：This is because
some of you may prefer to borrow a book rather than sit in the library
.
答案解析：这道题的题干在录音中几乎没有出现，给我们带来很大的困扰。不过我们可以很明显的听到选项A的对应，同时B选项完全没有提到，C选项也只是说了借阅时间，而没有说是否能够延长，因此统统排除，只能选A。大家要注意的是，雅思听力选择题中很多时候我们选一个选项并不是因为这个选项百分百正确，而是因为其他选项都存在明显错误，只能选它。
第36题答案：B
对应原文：As your Training Supervisor,
I just oversee your induction
and will not be around after this initial week.
答案解析：这道题的关键在于识别inducation与orientation的同义替换。录音中虽然提到了C选项的Section manager，但只是介绍了他们的职责，与training supervisor没什么关系。
第37题答案：B
对应原文：However,
the training will also include some time on the computers
. … I realise most of you know how to organise files but we can show you the
different ways to run data programmes
答案解析：前面都在介绍图书馆的各种项目，然后就提到了计算机程序的培训，因此可以认为该培训是在图书馆中进行的，确定答案为B。
第38题答案：A
对应原文：Your tutors will tell you at the outset how to set out the chapters they require but you will need to
ask them how they would like you to organise the bibliography
because it varies depending on your subject area.
答案解析：根据bibliography这一有明显特点的词定位到这一句，录音中明确提到了tutor，由此确定答案。
第39题答案：B
对应原文：
When you’ve got something together the trainer here will look through the draft version for you to see if it’s OK
.
答案解析：原文中提到the trainer here。考虑到说话人图书馆员工的身份，很容易确定这一项目是在图书馆中进行的，确定B为答案。
第40题答案：C
对应原文：
If you require language lessons then they are available from the International Centre next to the Law Department
.
答案解析：根据language定位到这句话，选项中的antoher section在原文中被具体到International Center上，由此确定C为答案。除此之外，如果我们在考试中很肯定前面三道题目是正确的，而C选项还没有选过。则C选项几乎百分百为最后一题的答案。

剑桥雅思6 test 1 section 1听力原文与答案 notes on sports club
这篇雅思听力section 1是典型的健身房场景。虽然后面5-8题的表格填空有些简单，但其他题目基本涉及到了该场景的主要内容，如各种各样的课程、会员卡类型、设施、教练等（
雅思备考听力篇 剑6 test 1 section 1 雅思听力高频词汇
）。
易错点主要是第4题和第9题。前者salad bar的短语搭配有些罕见，不少同学都反应不过来。后者则是出现了语序颠倒，先说的答案，再说的instructor，特别容易错过。
点击查看这篇雅思听力具体题目的
答案解析
：
剑桥雅思6Test1听力Section1答案解析
剑6 test 1 Section 1
雅思听力
原文
WOMAN: Good morning, oh sorry, it’s gone 12, I’ll start again, good afternoon,
Kingswell Sports Club
, how can I help you?
Example
MAN: Oh, good afternoon. I was wondering if you could give me some information about membership and facilities.
WOMAN: Of course. What would you like to know?
MAN: Do you have tennis courts, for example?
WOMAN: No, I’m afraid we don’t. We’re primarily a golf club.
MAN: What about football? I heard you had a team.
WOMAN: No, I’m sorry. Perhaps you’re thinking about Fresham Sports Centre.
MAN: Oh, right. I know it. I’ve played badminton there.
WOMAN: Have you? They’ve got a lot of facilities we don’t have and vice versa. We do have
a keep-fit studio
, which is very popular with members, and then as well as that there’s
swimming
, of course.
Q1   Q2
MAN: That’s good. I like to swim every day.
WOMAN: We have a range of classes too.
MAN: Do you have judo classes? I’m keen to learn.
WOMAN: Well, at the moment we offer kick-boxing. We’re planning to add judo and stretch classes soon. We’re currently running a range of
yoga classes
, too.
Q3
MAN: What about relaxing after exercise? I assume you have a restaurant or something.
WOMAN: At the moment, we’ve got
a salad bar
which is very popular. We’ll also have a fully-licensed restaurant by the end of the year.
Q4
MAN: Sounds good!
WOMAN: What kind of membership are you interested in?
MAN: Um I’m not really sure. What are the options?
WOMAN: Well, there are three different membership schemes.
MAN: I see. What’s the difference?
WOMAN: Well, the first one’s called Gold, and you can use all the facilities at any time of the day or week. You can also join in as many classes as you like for free.
MAN: That sounds good. Is it very expensive?
WOMAN: Well, you pay a ￡250 joining fee and then it’s ￡450 – oh no, I’m sorry, it’s just gone up by ￡50, sorry about that – it’s now
￡500
for the annual subscription fee.
Q5
MAN: Right, got that. And what’s the next type?
WOMAN: Well, that’s Silver – it’s the same as Gold except you have to pay a small fee of
￡1.00
per lesson for any you do and you can only use the centre at certain times.
Q6
MAN: I see. So when exactly?
WOMAN: You can only use the facilities
between 10 am and 4.30 pm
.
Q7
MAN: So I couldn’t use the pool at 8 in the morning or evening, then?
WOMAN: That’s right.
MAN: OK. And the price for that? Is the joining fee the same as for Gold?
WOMAN: Actually, it’s slightly less than the ￡250 – it’s ￡225, but the annual fee is only ￡300. Does that sound more like what you want?
MAN: Well, it’s still rather more expensive than I thought. I’m a student here in England and I’m only here for six months.
WOMAN: Ah, then the Bronze scheme would probably suit you best.
MAN: How is that different?
WOMAN: Well, some of the facilities have restricted use.
MAN: And do I have to pay for classes?
WOMAN: Yes, it’s ￡3 for each class you join.
MAN:  I see. And what are the hours then?
WOMAN: Between 10.30 and 3.30 weekdays only and you pay a ￡50 joining fee. The annual fee is
￡180
– it works out at ￡15 a month, so that would be quite a lot cheaper.  Q8
MAN: Oh, that should be all right. I could come in my free periods. What do I have to do if I want to join?
WOMAN: Well, we book you in for an
assessment
with an instructor, who will show you how to use all the equipment. If you want to organise a trial session and look around the centre, you’ll need to speak to David Kynchley.
Q9
MAN: Hmm. Could you spell that please?
WOMAN: Yes, David
K-Y-N-C-H-L-E-Y
. I’ll give you his direct line number. It’s oh-four-five-eight-nine-five-three-double one.    Q10
MAN: Thanks.
WOMAN: Thank you for calling Kingswell Sports Club.
剑6 test 1 Section 1雅思听力答案
1. keep-fit (studio)
2. swimming
3. yoga (classes)
4. salad bar
5. 500
6. 1
7. 10 am, 4.30 pm
8. 180
9. assessment
10. Kynchley

剑桥雅思6Test1听力Section1答案解析 notes on sports club
剑桥雅思6听力第一套题目第一部分的10道题由4道笔记填空，4道表格填空，以及2道单句填空构成。整体难度偏低，尤其是中间的表格，几乎是在送分。不过第1题和第9题还是颇有心机，会造成一些麻烦。下面是具体每道题目的答案解析，以供大家参考。
点击查看这篇
雅思听力
对应的
录音原文
，以及其中出现的需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思6 test 1 section 1听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑6 test 1 section 1 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思6 Test 1 Section 1听力答案解析
第1题答案：
keep-fit (studio)
对应原文：They’ve got a lot of facilities we don’t have and vice versa. We do have
a keep-fit studio
答案解析：这道题的难点有两个。一是男性提出了多种项目，但都被依次否决，很容易仍然心浮气躁。而是keep-fit studio这一短语不少同学可能不太熟悉。但它是健身房场景中最容易考察的内容之一，所以一定要熟练掌握。
第2题答案：
swimming
对应原文： and then as well as that there’s
swimming
, of course.
答案解析：as well as提示答案即将到来，swimming本身也没有什么难度，很容易写出来。
第3题答案：
yoga (classes)
对应原文：Well, at the moment we offer kick-boxing. We’re planning to add judo and stretch classes soon. We’re currently running a range of
yoga classes
, too
答案解析：kick-boxing提示答案即将到来。judo和stretch classes因为是并列，而且还有plan这种表示计文章来自老烤鸭雅思划的词汇，可以直接排除。最终确定yoga classes是答案。不过这一题中出现的所有运动项目都需要大家掌握。
第4题答案：
salad bar
对应原文：At the moment, we’ve got
a salad bar
which is very popular.
答案解析：确定答案位置毫无难度，主要难点还在于salad bar的含义。它其实就是大家在餐厅里常见的自主沙拉区，可以自己随便拿东西浇酱汁。
第5题答案：
500
对应原文：then it’s ￡450 – oh no, I’m sorry, it’s just gone up by ￡50, sorry about that – it’s now
￡500
for the annual subscription fee.
答案解析：虽然设置了干扰项450，但后面的否定十分明显，几乎不可能出错，很容易确定答案为500。唯一需要注意的就是誊写答题卡的时候500前面的货币符号并不需要带。
第6题答案：
1
对应原文：it’s the same as Gold except you have to pay a small fee of
￡1.00
per lesson for any you do
答案解析：毫无难度，注意听数字即可。
第7题答案：
10 am, 4.30 pm
对应原文：You can only use the facilities
between 10 am and 4.30 pm
.
答案解析：根据题干同一列内容可以推测出空上应该填具体的时间，写完上一题答案之后注意听时间即可。
第8题答案：
180
对应原文： The annual fee is
￡180
答案解析：因为one hundred and eighty中的连读，这道题很容易写成190。大家要注意分辨/ei/和/ai/这两个元音的差别。
第9题答案：
assessment
对应原文：Well, we book you in for an
assessment
with an instructor
答案解析：这道题设置了两个难点。一是进行了语序颠倒，将本来在空前的instructor放在空后；二是assessment这一单词本身可能会有些陌生。它经常出现在健身房场景中表示评测，也会出现在Section 3的学术场景中表示考试或者测试。
第10题答案：
Kynchley
对应原文：Yes, David
K-Y-N-C-H-L-E-Y
.
答案解析：根据题干可以推断出空上应该填人名，注意听拼写即可。

剑桥雅思6 test 1 section 2听力原文与答案 rivenden city theater
这篇雅思听力section 2的前半部分无论是从场景上，还是从题型上，又或者是具体的出题方式上都十分符合现在考试的模式。尤其是介绍剧院这个话题，更是现在听力考试中非常容易考察的内容，所以其中出现的场景单词必须得好好掌握才行。
易错点方面，除了后面4道填空题因为语速过快，很容易跟不上之外，前面的匹配都是正常出题模式，没有什么特别容易犯错的地方。

剑6 test 1 Section 2
雅思听力
原文
MAN: And here on Radio Rivenden we have Lynne Rawley, the Public Relations Officer of our own Rivenden City Theatre. Hello, Lynne.
LYNNE: Hello.
MAN: Now, the theatre is reopening soon after its three-year redevelopment programme, isn’t it?
LYNNE: That’s right, and there are a lot of improvements. The first thing people will see when they go in is that the foyer has been repainted in the original green and gold. Then
the box office has been reoriented, with its own access from the side of the building
instead of through the foyer, which means it can be open longer hours, and has more space, too. The shop that used to be in the foyer, which sold books and CDs, is the one part of the redevelopment which isn’t yet complete. The plan is to find new premises for it near the theatre, and we’ve had difficulty finding somewhere suitable.
We hope to reopen the shop in the next few months
.
Q11  Q12
MAN: Will audiences find any difference in the auditorium?
LYNNE: Yes, we’ve increased the leg-room between the rows. This means that
there are now fewer seats
but we’re sure audiences will be much happier. And we’ve installed air conditioning, so it won’t get so hot and stuffy. We already had a few seats which were suitable for wheelchair users, and
now there are twice as many
, which we hope will meet demand. Something else that will benefit audiences is the
new lifts. The two we used to have were very small and slow. They’ve now gone, and we’ve got much more efficient ones
.
Q13  Q14  Q15
MAN: Anything for the performers?
LYNNE: Yes, we’ve made a number of improvements backstage.
The small, dark dressing rooms we used to have have been converted into two large airy rooms
, so they’re much more comfortable now. And the state-of-the-art electronic sound and lighting systems have been installed.
Q16
MAN: OK, so what’s the first play that audiences can see when the theatre reopens?
LYNNE: We’ve got a very exciting production of Peter Shaffer’s Royal Hunt of the Sun, which is currently touring the country. That starts on October the 13th and runs till
the 19th
. We’re experimenting a bit with the time the curtain goes up. We used to start all our performances at 7.30, but that made it difficult for people to go home by public transport, so instead we’re beginning at
7
, because at 9.45, when it finishes, there are still buses running. Tickets are already selling fast. The Friday and Saturday performances sold out almost immediately and, in fact, now there are only tickets for
Monday
and
Thursday
.
Q17  Q18  Q19
MAN: How much are they?
LYNNE: We’ve introduced a simpler price structure. Ticket prices used to range from ￡6 to ￡30 but now they’re all
￡18
. They’re available from the box office, in person, by phone, fax or post, or online.
Q20
MAN: OK, Lynne, now if you’d like to give the contact details for the theatre…
剑6 test 1 Section 2雅思听力答案
11. B   12. G   13. C   14. A   15. E
16. D   17. (October) 19th   18. 7   19. Monday, Thursday   20. 18

剑桥雅思6Test1听力Section2答案解析 rivenden city theater
剑桥雅思6听力第一套题目第二部分的10道题由6道匹配和4道填空构成。后面的填空语速虽然较快，但考察的知识点有些简单，更加偏向于Section 1。不过前面的匹配无论是从形式上还是从难度上都跟现在的雅思听力考试比较符合，大家可以用心体会一下。下面是具体每道题目的答案解析。

剑桥雅思6 test 1 section 2听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑6 test 1 section 2 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思6 Test 1 Section 2听力答案解析
第11题答案：B
对应原文：Then
the box office has been reoriented, with its own access from the side of the building
instead of through the foye
答案解析：这道题偏难一些，录音中有两个提示点。一是reoriented，即朝向改变；二是access，即入口，听懂任何一个都可以确定B是答案。不过前一个单词偏难，而后一个单词读的偏弱，都不太好捕捉。
第12题答案：G
对应原文：
We hope to reopen the shop in the next few months
答案解析：录音中虽然做了很长的铺垫，但最后说了一句我们希望几个月内重文章来自老烤鸭雅思新开放商店。即商店目前处于关闭状态，由此确定答案为G。
第13题答案：C
对应原文：Yes, we’ve increased the leg-room between the rows. This means that
there are now fewer seats
but we’re sure audiences will be much happier.
答案解析：一些同学容易受前面increase the leg-room的干扰，直接选了D。但它指的是座位之间的腿部空间有所增加，而非座位本身。后面fewer才是答案真正对应的点。
第14题答案：A
对应原文：We already had a few seats which were suitable for wheelchair users, and
now there are twice as many
答案解析：这道题目比较简单一些，主要考察倍数的替换，将double换成twice而已。
第15题答案：E
对应原文： Something else that will benefit audiences is the
new lifts. The two we used to have were very small and slow. They’ve now gone, and we’ve got much more efficient ones
.
答案解析：原来的电梯又小又慢，现在有更加效率的新的了。因此确定答案为E（替换）。一些同学可能觉得以前的比较小，现在的一定很大，因此推测答案为D。但无论是老烤鸭雅思听力还是阅读，除非万不得已，否则的话只能根据原文中给出的明确信息做题，千万不要推断。
第16题答案：D
对应原文：
The small, dark dressing rooms we used to have have been converted into two large airy rooms
答案解析：原文中提到“原来又小，又黑的更衣室被转变为两个大型又通风的房间”。small和large前后对比，因此确定答案为D。
第17题答案：（October） 19th
对应原文：That starts on October the 13th and runs till
the 19th
.
答案解析：从表头的dates和空前的October 13th很容易推断空上应该填个日期。注意听序数词即可。
第18题答案：7
对应原文：We used to start all our performances at 7.30, but, this article is from Laokaoya website, that made it difficult for people to go home by public transport, so instead we’re beginning at
7
答案解析：录音中先提到了7.30，但说人们乘坐公共交通回家不太方便，现在改成了7。除了听明白之外，我们还可以根据but和instead这两个转折词进行判断。
第19题答案：Monday, Thursday
对应原文：in fact, now there are only tickets for
Monday
and
Thursday
答案解析：虽然我们在读题的时候无法根据题干推断空上填的是周几。但录音中句子结构毫无改变，很容易确定答案为Monday和Thursday。
第20题答案：18
对应原文：Ticket prices used to range from ￡6 to ￡30 but now they’re all
￡18
答案解析：出题套路跟第18题有些类似，都是先给出一个符合猜想的数字，然后再进行更正，注意but即可。

剑桥雅思6 test 1 section 3听力原文与答案
这篇雅思听力Section 3以填空题为主，这种情况在考试中比较少见。从过去一年的50场考试来看，只有一次考试中的Section 3出现了全部是填空的情况。但这并不意味着Section 3的填空题就很简单。相比于Section 4而言，它的节奏会快很多，题目与题目之间的间隔也很短。非常容易听到一道题之后漏了下一道，或者干脆从头到尾都没有找到地方。
具体到这道题目来说，比较容易出错的主要是第22题和第25题。两者都没有明显的提示词，而且答案读的很弱，不太容易识别。

剑6 test 1 Section 3
雅思听力
原文
TUTOR:                   Hello, can I help you?
BRIAN:                    I was told to come here, because I’d like to talk to someone about taking a management course.
TUTOR:                   Right. I’m one of the tutors, so I should be able to help you.
BRIAN:                    Oh, good. My name’s Brian Ardley. I’ve decided to enrol on a part-time management course. A friend of mine took one last year, and recommended it to me.
TUTOR:                   Right.
BRIAN:                    Is there anything I should do before the course, like reading or anything?
TUTOR:                   We prefer to integrate reading with the course, so we don’t give out a reading list in advance. But we like people to write a case study, describing an organisation they know.
BRIAN:                    I’ve already done that, as my friends told me you wanted one. But would it be possible to
sit in on a teaching session
, to see what it’s like? I haven’t been a student for quite a while.
Q21
TUTOR:                   Fine. Just let me know which date, and I’ll arrange it with the tutor.
BRIAN:                    Now, could I ask you about the college facilities, please?
TUTOR:                   Anything in particular?
BRIAN:                    Well, the course is one day a week, all day, isn’t it? So presumably it’s possible to buy food?
TUTOR:                   Yes, the refectory’s open all day.
BRIAN:                    Does it cater for special diets? I have some food allergies.
TUTOR:                   Provided you warn the refectory
in advance
, it won’t be a problem.
Q22
BRIAN:                    Good. What about facilities for young children? I’d like to bring my daughter here while I’m studying.
TUTOR:                   How old is she?
BRIAN:                    Three.
TUTOR:                   Then she’s eligible to join the
nursery
, which is supervised by a qualified Nursery Nurse. The waiting list for a place is quite long though, so you ought to apply now.
Q23
BRIAN:                    OK.
TUTOR:                   I don’t know if our careers advice service would be of any interest to you?
BRIAN:                    Yes, it might help me decide how to develop my career after the course.
TUTOR:                   The centre has a lot of reference materials, and staff qualified to give guidance on a one-to-one basis.
BRIAN:                    I noticed a fitness centre next to the college. Is that for students?
TUTOR:                   It’s open to everyone, but students pay an
annual fee
that’s much less than the general public pay.
Q24
BRIAN:                    And presumably the college library stocks newspapers and journals, as well as books?
TUTOR:                   Yes, and there’s also an audio-visual room, for viewing and listening to videos, cassettes, and so on.
BRIAN:                    Is there also access to computers?
TUTOR:                   Yes, your
tutor
will need to arrange with the technical support team for you to get a password, so ask him or her about it when you start the course.
Q25
BRIAN:                    OK.
TUTOR:                   By the way, do you know about our Business Centre?
BRIAN:                    No. What’s that?
TUTOR:                   It’s a training resource a collection of materials for people to study on their own, or use in their own organisations.
BRIAN:                    Uhuh. You mean books and videos?
TUTOR:                   Yes, and manuals for self-study. Plus a lot of computer-based materials, so people can work through them at their own speed, and repeat anything they aren’t sure about. And you can hire
laptops
to use in your own home or workplace as well as
printers
that you can take away.
Q26/27
BRIAN:                    Does it have anything that I could use to improve my study skills? I don’t have much idea about
report writing
, and I’m sure I’ll need it on the course.
Q28
TUTOR:                   Oh yes, there’s plenty of useful material. Just ask one of the staff.
BRIAN:                    Does the centre cover all the main areas of business?
TUTOR:                   Yes, topics like finance, and of course
marketing
– that’s a popular one. Local managers seem to queue up to borrow the videos!
Q29
BRIAN:                    So it isn’t just for students, then?
TUTOR:                   No, it’s for members only, but anyone can join.
BRIAN:                    How much does it cost?
TUTOR:                   ￡100 a year for a company, and ￡50 for an
individual
, with no discount for students, I’m afraid.
Q30
BRIAN:                    That’s very helpful. Well, I think that’s all. I’d better go home and fill in the enrolment form. Thanks for all your help.
TUTOR:                   You’re welcome. Goodbye.
BRIAN:                    Goodbye.
剑6 test 1 Section 3雅思听力答案
21. A
22. in advance
23. nursery
24. annual fee
25. tutor
26. laptops
27. printers
28. report writing
29. marketing
30. individual

剑桥雅思6Test1听力Section3答案解析 独家
剑桥雅思6听力第一套题目第三部分的10道题由1道单项选择，4道表格填空，以及5道总结型填空构成。其中22-25题（23题除外）虽然采用表格的形式，但表头却并没有任何作用，实际上更加偏向于单句填空一些。因为是Section 3的填空，所以题目整体节奏较快，大家需要适应一下。下面是具体每道题的答案解析。
点击查看这篇
雅思听力
对应的
录音原文
与需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思6 test 1 section 3听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑6 test 1 section 3 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思6 Test 1 Section 3听力答案解析
第21题答案：A
对应原文：But would it be possible to
sit in on a teaching session
, to see what it’s like?
答案解析：这道题目的关键在于对sit in on的理解，它表示旁听（课程），列席（会议）的意思。不过哪怕不知道sit in on能够跟attend同义替换，选项B和C在录音中也完全没有提到。而A选项的class又跟teaching session直接相关，通过这一点也可以推断出答案。
第22题答案：in advance
对应原文： Provided you warn the refectory
in advance
, it won’t be a problem.
答案解析：前两句其实就已经提到了refectory提示大家答案即将到来。但inform与warn的同义替换并不常见，很多同学可能会反应不过来。
第23题答案：nursery
对应原文：Then she’s eligible to join the
nursery
, which is supervised by a qualified Nursery Nurse.
答案解析：这道题要联系上文才比较好做一些。男性先询文章来自老烤鸭雅思问是否有任何适合儿童的设施（提及表头facility），然后女性才给出这一回答。这种考察方式跟Section 1有些类似，都是看大家对问答节奏的掌握。
第24题答案：annual fee
对应原文：It’s open to everyone, but students pay an
annual fee
that’s much less than the general public pay.
答案解析：听到fitness center知道答案即将出现。这道题采用了语序颠倒的手法，本来在空前的reduced一词被放在了答案之后，考察大家的短期记忆能力。
第25题答案：tutor
对应原文：Yes, your
tutor
will need to arrange with the technical support team
答案解析：跟23题类似，男性先询问computers的事情，然后女性再给出答案。但与23题相比，这道题的空前提示词（ask）完全没有出现，进一步增加了做题难度。
第26题答案：laptops
对应原文： And you can hire
laptops
to use in your own home or workplace
答案解析：题干中的possible与原文中的can同义替换，hire原词出现，很容易确定答案为laptops。
第27题答案：printers
对应原文：as well as
printers
that you can take
答案解析：这道题属于并列关系词的同义替换。题干中的and被as well as代替，不过这两个词汇大家都比较熟悉，不存在什么太大的难度。
第28题答案：report writing
对应原文：  Does it have anything that I could use to improve my study skills? I don’t have much idea about
report writing
答案解析：听到study skills提示答案即将出现。虽然空前的e.g.在录音中没有对应，但根据句子位置和重读，很容易锁定report writing.
第29题答案：marketing
对应原文：Yes, topics like finance, and of course
marketing
答案解析：再次考察并列关系，不过finance和and都原词出现，相比于27题而言还要再简单一些。
第30题答案：individual
对应原文： ￡100 a year for a company, and ￡50 for an
individual
答案解析：这道题目中设置了小小的干扰项。出题人希望大家听到company就认为是答案。但它并不符合后面50这一条件，因此排除，锁定individual。

剑桥雅思6 test 1 section 4听力原文与答案 social history of the East End of London
这篇雅思听力Section 4介绍了伦敦东部的历史发展。因为整体题目采取表格的形式，并且给出了明确的时间，我们很容易定位答案所在的大体位置。但具体句子的提示并不明显，空前后词的作用也十分有限，反而导致正确率不高。后面的多选难度一般，哪怕听的不是很明白，我们也可以根据
雅思听力选择题蒙题技巧
，达到一定的正确率。

重点词汇
以及对应的题目
答案解析
：
剑桥雅思6Test1听力Section4答案解析
雅思备考听力篇 剑6 test 1 section 4 雅思听力高频词汇
剑6 test 1 Section 4
雅思听力
原文
In the last few weeks, we’ve been looking at various aspects of the social history of London, and this morning we’re continuing with a look at life in the area called the East End. I’ll start with a brief history of the district, and then focus on life in the first half of the twentieth century.
Back in the first to the fourth centuries AD, when the Romans controlled England, London grew into a town of 45,000 people, and what’s now the East End – the area by the river Thames, and along the road heading north-east from London to the coast – consisted of farmland with crops and livestock which helped to
feed
that population.
Q31
The Romans left in 410, at the beginning of the fifth century, and from then onwards the country suffered a series of invasions by tribes from present-day Germany and Denmark, the Angles, Saxons and Jutes, many of whom settled in the East End. The technology they introduced meant that
metal
and
leather
goods were produced there for the first time. And as the East End was by the river, ships could transport goods between there and foreign markets.
Q32
In the eleventh century, in 1066 to be precise, the Normans conquered England, and during the next few centuries London became one of the most powerful and prosperous cities in Europe. The East End benefited from this, and because there were fewer
restrictions
there than in the city itself, plenty of newcomers settled there from abroad, bringing their skills as workers, merchants or money-lenders during the next few hundred years.
Q33
In the sixteenth century the first dock was dug where
ships
were constructed, eventually making the East End the focus of massive international trade. And in the late sixteenth century, when much of the rest of
England
was suffering economically, a lot of agricultural workers came to the East End to look for alternative work.
Q34    Q35
In the seventeenth century, the East End was still a series of separate, semi-rural settlements. There was a shortage of accommodation, so marshland was drained and
built
on to house the large numbers of people now living there.
Q36
By the nineteenth century London was the busiest port in the world, and this became the main source of employment in the East End. Those who could afford to live in more pleasant surroundings moved out, and the area became one where the vast majority of people lived in extreme
poverty
and suffered from appalling sanitary conditions.
Q37
That brief outline takes us to the beginning of the twentieth century, and now we’ll turn to housing.
At the beginning of the century, living conditions for the majority of working people in East London were very basic indeed.
Houses were crowded closely together and usually very badly built
, because there was no regulation. But the poor and needy were attracted by the possibility of work, and they had to be housed. It was the availability, rather than the condition, of the housing that was the major concern for tenants and landlords alike.
Q38
Few houses had electricity at this time, so other sources of power were used, like coal for the fires which heated perhaps just one room.
Of course, the smoke from these contributed a great deal to the air pollution for which London used to be famous.
Q39
A tiny, damp, unhealthy house like this might well be occupied by two full families, possibly including several children, grandparents, aunts and uncles.
Q40
Now, before I go on to health implications of this way of life, I’ll say something about food and nutrition.
剑6 test 1 Section 4雅思听力答案
31. feed
32. metal leather
33. restrictions
34. ships
35. England
36. built
37. poverty
38-40. CEF

剑桥雅思6Test1听力Section4答案解析 social history of the East End of London
剑桥雅思6听力第一套题目第四部分由7道表格填空和1道7选3的多选组成。因为表格中给出了明确的时间，定位答案的大体位置还是比较容易的。但录音中句子结构替换幅度比较大，而且答案单词读的也不是很明显，所以确定具体答案单词仍然具有一定难度。下面是具体每道题目的答案解析。
点击查看这篇
雅思听力
对应的
录音原文
以及需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思6 test 1 section 4听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑6 test 1 section 4 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思6 Test 1 Section 4听力答案解析
第31题答案：feed
对应原文：consisted of farmland with crops and livestock which helped to
feed
that population.
答案解析：定位词1st-4th century离答案较远，给题目增加了许多难度。解题关键主要在于事先判断空上填的应该是个动词，并及时识别出people与population的同义替换。
第32题答案：metal leather
对应原文：The technology they introduced meant that
metal
and
leather
goods were produced there for the first time.
答案解析：根据5th-10th centuries定位段落，根据technology定位具体句子。题干上需要填写并列的两个单词，听的时候注意并列结构即可。不过单词拼写上会存在一定的难度。
第33题答案：restrictions
对应原文：The East End benefited from this, and because there were fewer
restrictions
there than in the city itself
答案解析：根据11th century定位大体段落，根据East End定位具文章来自老烤鸭雅思体句子，题干中lack of与fewer同义替换，由此确定答案为restrictions。
第34题答案：ships
对应原文：In the sixteenth century the first dock was dug where
ships
were constructed
答案解析：根据16th century定位具体句子，题干中building与constructed同义替换，由此确定答案为ships。
第35题答案：England
对应原文：And in the late sixteenth century, when much of the rest of
England
was suffering economically, a lot of agricultural workers
答案解析：听到and和in the late sixteenth century意识到答案即将到来。other parts与rest同义替换，由此确定答案为England。
第36题答案：built
对应原文：so marshland was drained and
built
on to house the large numbers of people now living there.
答案解析：听到marshland与drained意识到答案即将到来，从题干语法结构可以推测空上填的应该是个动词。再加上空后词on的原词出现，由此确定答案为built。
第37题答案：poverty
对应原文：the vast majority of people lived in extreme
poverty
and suffered from appalling sanitary conditions.
答案解析：听到people与lived确定答案很快就要出现，题干中的great与extreme替换，由此确定答案为poverty。
第38题答案：F
对应原文：
Houses were crowded closely together and usually very badly built
, because there was no regulation.
答案解析：需要注意的是，多选题中原文一般都不按照选项顺序进行，因此需要大家在做题的时候通览所有选项才可以。
原文中提到因为没有规定，房屋拥挤在一起，建造也很差，对应F选项中的poor standards of building。
第39题答案：C
对应原文：
Few houses had electricity at this time, so other sources of power were used, like coal for the fires which heated perhaps just one room.
答案解析：原文中提到，因为当时很少房屋有电，只能使用使用诸如煤一样的燃料。而这只能温暖一个房间。可见采暖存在很大的问题。由此确定C为正确选项。
第40题答案：E
对应原文：
A tiny, damp, unhealthy house like this might well be occupied by two full families, possibly including several children, grandparents, aunts and uncles.
答案解析：原文中具体描述了房屋的拥挤程度，一间狭小、潮湿、不健康的房子可能住着两个家庭，包括好几个孩子，爷爷奶奶，和叔叔阿姨。即过度拥挤，由此确定E为答案。

内容:
剑桥雅思6 test 2 Section 1听力原文与答案 children’s art and craft workshops
这篇雅思听力Section 1是典型的课程咨询场景，即家长要为自己的孩子报名某种辅导班，询问课程开始的日期、类型、适宜人群、地点、需要携带的物品等内容(
雅思备考听力篇 剑6 test 2 section 1 雅思听力高频词汇
)。题型方面，前5道题的单句填空非常贴近目前考试的趋势，后5道题的表格也经常在Section 1中出现。
易错点主要是第1题和第8题。其中第1题的8跟后面的years有连读，听起来有些像18。也有些同学因为比较着急，写成了前面的5。第8题则主要是词汇的问题，不少同学因为不知道top可以表示瓶盖的意思，犹犹豫豫不敢写导致出现错误。
点击查看这篇雅思听力对应的题目
答案解析
：
剑桥雅思6Test2听力Section1答案解析
剑6 test 2 Section 1
雅思听力
原文
MAN:                        Good morning, Synmouth Museum. Can I help you?
WOMAN:                 Oh yes. Good morning. I’m interested in the children’s workshops and I’d like a little more information, please.
MAN:                       Do you mean the Art and Craft workshops?
WOMAN:                 Yes. A friend of a friend mentioned them – the children do painting and make models and so forth.
MAN:                       Yes, of course. Um, where to begin? First of all, as you probably know, they run every
Saturday
.
Example
WOMAN:                 Fine. And what about ages?
MAN:                       Well, all ages from five upwards are welcome, though we do ask that children below
eight
years of age are accompanied by an adult.
Q1
WOMAN:                 Fine. That wouldn’t be a problem. What about cost?
MAN:                       Well, I think you’ll find them very reasonable. It’s ￡2.50 a child, with 80 pence off for two or more children from the same family.
WOMAN:                 Oh yes, very reasonable. And are they held in the main museum?
MAN:                       Not exactly. They’re nearby.
WOMAN:                 Could you give me the full address? I don’t know the area very well.
MAN:                       Yes, it’s Winter House.
WOMAN:                 Right.
MAN:                       And that’s in Tamer Street.
WOMAN:                 Could you spell that please?
MAN:                       Yes,
T-A-M-E-R Street
.
Q2
WOMAN:                 Lovely.
MAN:                       And I do need to tell you that there’s a security entrance, so you need to press the
green button
for someone to let you in. Don’t press the red button please, but don’t worry, it’s all clearly labelled.
Q3
WOMAN:                 OK. And one more question – is parking available nearby? We’re driving in from out of town.
MAN:                       Your best bet is to leave your car at the back of the
library
– on a Saturday morning there are plenty of spaces there. It’s right next door to the museum.
Q4
WOMAN:                 And can I ask about booking places?
MAN:                       Yes, and I must tell you, you really should book by calling the
education department
here.
Q5
WOMAN:                 Oh, I’m sorry, should I have rung them instead of the main museum number?
MAN:                       No, that’s fine this time, please don’t worry. But for future reference, I’ll give you the direct number. It’s two hundred-seven-six-five.
WOMAN:                 Great, I’ve got that.
MAN:                       But I’m very happy to give you information about the next two workshops. On Saturday the 16th there’s Building
Castles
.
Q6
WOMAN:                 Oh, sounds great!
MAN:                       This involves quite a bit of glue, so just make sure the kids are in
old clothes
.
Q7
WOMAN:                 I know, ones I don’t mind getting mucky.
MAN:                       Exactly. And if possible, could you bring along
bottle tops
which the children might be able to use in the models, you know, as decoration?
Q8
WOMAN:                 We’ll certainly try to find some for you.
MAN:                       Then the following week…
WOMAN:                 That’ll be the 23rd, won’t it?
MAN:                       Yes, that’s right. On that day, it’s what we call
Undersea Worlds
. This is where they make scenes with fishes, underground caverns and so on.
Q9
WOMAN:                 Is that likely to get very dirty? Lots of paint splashes?
MAN:                       Not really, so we don’t recommend any special clothes for that one. But if you could search out some
silver paper
to bring along to use in the sessions, you know, it’s shiny – it looks like water, that’d be great.
Q10
WOMAN:                 Yes, of course. We’ll see what we can come up with. Well, thank you ever so much for all your help. The sessions sound really good and I’ll certainly book up for the next two.
MAN:                       Lovely. Thanks very much for ringing.
WOMAN:                 Bye.
MAN:                       Bye-bye.
剑6 test 2 Section 1雅思听力答案
1. 8
2. Tamer
3. green button
4. library
5. education department
6. castles
7. old clothes
8. bottle tops
9. Undersea Worlds
10. silver paper

内容:
剑桥雅思6Test2听力Section1答案解析 children’s art and craft workshops
剑桥雅思6听力第二套题目第一部分由5道单句填空和5道表格填空构成，属于现在雅思听力考试比较常见的题型组合方式。虽然其中确实存在一些易错点和稍微具有拼写难度的答案单词，但整体难度一般。下面是具体题目的答案解析。
点击查看这篇
雅思听力
对应的
录音原文
与其中需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思6 test 2 Section 1听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑6 test 2 section 1 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思6 Test 2 Section 1听力答案解析
第1题答案：8
对应原文：all ages from five upwards are welcome, though we do ask that children below
eight
years of age
答案解析：这道题前面设置了个小小的干扰项，不过还是比较好区分的。主要难点在于eight读的比较轻，由于years稍微有些连读，对于听音辨音能力较差的同学而言不太好识别。
第2题答案：Tamer
对应原文：Yes,
T-A-M-E-R Street
.
答案解析：题目很简单，照着拼写即可。雅思听力中的街文章来自老烤鸭雅思道名有两种出题方式，一种是像现在这样考察大家的单词拼写，另一种则是给些比较简单的单词，考察大家的反应能力。
第3题答案：green button
对应原文：so you need to press the
green button
for someone to let you in. Don’t press the red button please
答案解析：题干中的push被替换为press，由此确定答案。原文里后面还通过否定的方式设置了red button这一干扰项，只要注意don’t即可。
第4题答案：library
对应原文：  Your best bet is to leave your car at the back of the
library
答案解析：题干中的behind在录音中替换成at the back of，由此确定答案。这组同义替换在雅思听力中非常常见，大家务必要记清楚。
第5题答案：education department
对应原文： Yes, and I must tell you, you really should book by calling the
education department
here.
答案解析：题干中的phoning被替换成calling，由此确定答案为education department。其中department在这里表示部门的意思，也算是雅思听力中比较常见的一个单词。
第6题答案：castles
对应原文： On Saturday the 16th there’s Building
Castles
.
答案解析：空前词building毫无替换直接出现，很容易锁定答案。主要难度还在于castle的拼写。请大家一定记着中间还有个t，忘掉的话肯定就没分了。
第7题答案：old clothes
对应原文：so just make sure the kids are in
old clothes
答案解析：从表头children advised to wear可以推断出空上应该填具体的穿着。上一题结束之后根据问答节奏定位大体的位置，只有old clothes符合这一含义，由此确定答案。
第8题答案：bottle tops
对应原文： And if possible, could you bring along
bottle tops
答案解析：表头中的bring原词出现，确定答案并不难。不过一些同学因为不知道tops在这里表示瓶盖，犹豫半天都不太敢写。
第9题答案：Undersea Worlds
对应原文： On that day, it’s what we call
Undersea Worlds
答案解析：答案不算太难，但因为是个专有名词，所以词组搭配不太常见。有些同学会写成undersea words。注意单词中间有无转音即可。
第10题答案：silver paper
对应原文：But if you could search out some
silver paper
to bring along
答案解析：难点主要在silver（银色）的拼写上。除此之外，雅思听力还经常考察gold（金色），purple（紫色），pink（粉色），grey（灰色），blue（蓝色）等颜色。

内容:
剑桥雅思6 test 2 Section 2听力原文与答案 train information
这篇Section 2无论是从听力录音的推进，还是讨论的话题方面其实都更像是Section 1的内容。首先，按照雅思官方的说法，Section 2应该是独白，但这道题前半部分明显是对话。其次，Section 2的场景通常为组织机构、活动、以及景点的介绍，而非这篇的交通咨询。
易错点主要是第11题和第14题。11题采用了语序颠倒的出题方式，而且king street作为车站名超出了不少同学的认知，导致反应不过来。第14题则主要是单词，如果不知道refreshment有食物的意思就难很多。至于后面的多选虽然也有一定难度，但无论是干扰项的设置还是同义替换都是常见的套路，因此不能算作易错点。

剑6 test 2 Section 2
雅思听力
原文
CUSTOMER:           Hello. Um my family and I are staying here in Trebirch for a week or two and we wanted to know about the train services. We’re hoping to do a few local trips.
RAILPERSON:         OK. Well, I can give you lots of details about all the trains going from Trebirch in the South West. This leaflet will be very helpful but I can tell you some of the main things. We’ve got two main train stations in the town.
King Street
is for local commuter lines and regional services.
Q11
CUSTOMER:           What about trains to London? I’ll need to go there on business for one day.
RAILPERSON:         Then you need to go to
Central
Station – that’s for all the national services. There are regular trains to London. They leave Trebirch
every half hour
on weekdays and every hour at weekends. It takes about two hours, a bit longer on Sundays. You’ve got a choice of first and second class and there’s a buffet car – though
refreshments
are included in the cost of a first class ticket.
Q12  Q13  Q14
CUSTOMER:           Ah right. Um, and have you got any information on different ticket types?
RAILPERSON:         Yes. There’s a range of ticket prices depending on when you travel and when you buy your ticket. There’s a standard open ticket which doesn’t have any restrictions. This can be bought in advance or on the day. You can also get various discounted tickets. A popular one is called the Supersave and, er, this is OK for travel after 8.45. Then there is the Special ticket, which is valid for travel after
10.15
. The Special tickets are also valid for travel at weekends. The cheapest tickets are called
Advance
and you have to buy them at least six days ahead. Only a certain number are available and you have to make seat
reservations
for these.
Q15  Q16  Q17
CUSTOMER:           Thanks. And are there lots of places to go to around here?
RAILPERSON:      Oh yes. You can enjoy many days out. Um there’s the Merthyr
Mining Museum
, which is only half an hour from Trebirch by train. Your children will find it just as fascinating as any theme park and they can ride in the original miners’ lifts and on the coal trains. There are special excursion tickets which include entrance fees. Mainline trains also offer direct services to Bristol, where you can visit the docks or spend a great day out with the children in the
zoo
, which is set in the parkland that used to surround the old castle. Er, special family awayday fares are available for this service now during the school holidays. Er, alternatively, you can be in Birmingham in only an hour and a half, where there’s lots to see and do including the new and internationally-acclaimed
climbing wall
built on the site of the old aquarium. We will also be running a special service to Newport when the new science museum opens next year, as we anticipate a lot of visitors in the opening weeks. I’d advise you to call early to book your tickets. Is that OK?
Q18  Q19  Q20
CUSTOMER:           Yes, thanks.

11. king street
12. central
13. half hour/30 minutes
14. refreshments
15. 10.15
16. Advance
17. (seat) reservation
18-20. CDG

剑桥雅思6听力第二套题目第二部分由4道单句填空，3道表格填空和1道7选3的多选构成。不同题型之间难度差异较大。前面的单句填空和后面的多项选择都跟目前雅思听力考试Section 2的难度比较接近，而中间的表格填空则有些过于简单。下面是具体每道题目的答案解析。
