：
雅思备考听力篇 剑9 test 4 section 2 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思9Test4听力Section2答案解析 water heater
剑桥雅思9 Test4 Section3
雅思听力
原文
MAN: Hello?
WOMAN: Hi. It’s Laura Carlton here. We’ve just arrived at the holiday flat, but I can’t get the hot water and heating to work.
MAN: Oh right! That’s easy. Don’t worry. In the upstairs cupboard, you’ll find the water heater. You’ll see three main controls on the left at the bottom of the heater.
The first one – the round one on the far left – is the most important one for the heating and hot water. It’s the main control switch (Q11)
. Make sure it’s in the ‘on’ position. The switch itself doesn’t light up, but the little square below will be black if the switch is ‘off’. That’s probably what’s happened – it’s got switched off by mistake. The middle one of these three controls – you’ll see it’s slightly larger than the first one – controls the radiators. If you feel cold while you’re there and need the radiators on, this needs to be turned to maximum. The last of the three controls – the one on the right – is usually on about a number four setting which for the water in the taps is usually quite hot enough.
Below the heating controls in the middle is a small round plastic button (Q12)
. If there isn’t enough water in the pipes, sometimes the heater goes out.
If this happens you’ll need to press this button to reset the heater (Q12)
. Hold it in for about five seconds and the heater should come on again. Then there’s
a little square indicator under the third knob that’s a kind of alarm light (Q13)
. It’llflash if you need to reset the heater.
WOMAN: It sounds complicated …
MAN: I’m sure you won’t have any problems with it. There should be some more instructions on the side of the heater. Call me back if you can’t make it work.
WOMAN: Okay.
WOMAN: While you’re on the phone, we haven’t managed to find a few things we need, like extra pillows for the beds and some washing powder. Is there any here?
MAN: Pillows … yes.
If you look in the cupboard, the large white one upstairs – to the left of the bathroom door (Q14)
– there should be four or five on the top shelf. And if you want to do some washing,
there’s some powder for that… probably by the back door. There’s a kind of shelf there above the sink (Q15)
. In fact, I’m sure there’s some there, in a large blue box. You need about half a cup full for each wash.
And that reminds me,
the spare key to the back door is hanging on a hook
on the wall by the sitting room window (Q16)
. Please make sure to put it back when you’ve used it. The previous guests lost it in the garden and I had to get another one made!  And if you have any trouble with the lamps, you’ll find
some spare bulbs in a large cardboard box. It’s on top of the washing machine (Q17)
with all kinds of useful things in it.
Oh, and another thing I forgot to mention when we last spoke …
WOMAN: Yes?
MAN:
I’ve left you a local map (Q18)
, so you’ll be able to find your way around easily. It shows the whole area. I put it
in the top drawer of the chest (Q18)
under the TV in your bedroom. There’s a whole file of local information in there too.
WOMAN: Thanks. What about visiting the town? Can you give us any advice?
MAN: Yes. You’ll need to take the car. It’s too far to walk from the flat really. You have to pay to leave your car in all the car parks now I’m afraid … I like the one that’s by the station best and you can walk to the town centre from there in five minutes. That’s where all the best restaurants are. But if you want a takeaway, the Italian one does really good pasta and pizzas. Call
7-3 double 2-8-1 (Q19)
for that one, or 7 double 6, double 1, 9 for the Chinese. They’re both good and they’ll both deliver to the flat.
As for places to visit, yes, do go and see the railway museum. The exhibition is small but really good. It gets very crowded on Sundays, so I suggest you visit it on a quieter day, later in the week, but not on
Thursdays (Q20)
which is market day – you won’t find anywhere to park and it’s also the only day of the week when they’re not open! Anything else?
WOMAN: Not for the moment. Thanks!
剑桥雅思9 Test4 Section2雅思听力答案
11. B
12. C
13. E
14. B
15. E
16. D
17. A
18. C
19. 732281
20. Thursday/Thursdays

剑桥雅思9Test4听力Section2答案解析 water heater
剑桥雅思9听力第四套题目第二部分由3道图例题，5道匹配题，以及2道填空题组成。其中匹配题与填空题的难度略低于目前考试的难度。而前面的图例题在真正考试中出现的频率很低，差不多是两年一次的样子。其做法与地图题并没有什么太大的不同。下面是具体每道题目的答案解析。
点击查看这篇
雅思听力
对应的
录音原文
与其中出现的需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思9Test4Section2听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑9 test 4 section 2 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思9 Test4 Section2听力答案解析
第11题答案：B
对应原文：The first one – the round one on the far left – is the most important one for the heating and hot water. It’s the main control switch. Make sure it’s in the ‘on’ position.
答案解析：听到round将目光放在第一排的三个按钮上，听到far left即可确认说的是第11题，由此锁定main control switch，确定B为答案。
第12题答案：C
对应原文：Below the heating controls in the middle is a small round plastic button. If there isn’t enough water in the pipes, sometimes the heater goes out. If this happens you’ll need to press this button to reset the heater
答案解析：这道题距离上一道题较远，需要一定的耐心。听到below the heating control即可确认说的是12题，在根据后面的reset判断C为答案。
第13题答案：E
对应原文：Then there’s
a little square indicator under the third knob that’s a kind of alarm light
. It’llflash if you need to reset the heater.
答案解析：听到under the third knob（第三个按钮下面），意识到文章来自老烤鸭雅思说的是第13题。原文中的alarm light与warning indicator同义替换，由此确定E为答案。
第14题答案：B
对应原文：
If you look in the cupboard, the large white one upstairs – to the left of the bathroom door
答案解析：这道题的难点主要在于cupboard的读音。变成组合词之后board中oar不再发/ɔː/的音，而是变成了/ə/的音，会给单词识别造成一定困难。
第15题答案：E
对应原文： And if you want to do some washing,
there’s some powder for that… probably by the back door. There’s a kind of shelf there above the sink
答案解析：这道题比较简单一些，听到back door和shelf即可确认E为答案。一些同学可能会受到后面sink的干扰，误选了G。但录音中说的是under而非above，由此排除。
第16题答案：D
对应原文：And that reminds me,
the spare key to the back door is hanging on a hook on the wall by the sitting room window
答案解析：这道题一上来先说了back door，可能会让人怀疑上一道题的答案。但随后就又说了sitting room和window，由此确定D为答案。
第17题答案：A
对应原文：And if you have any trouble with the lamps, you’ll find
some spare bulbs in a large cardboard box. It’s on top of the washing machine
答案解析：这道题比较简单一些，完全没有任何干扰项，也没有语音上的难点。根据box和washing machine即可确认A为答案。
第18题答案：C
对应原文：
I’ve left you a local map
, so you’ll be able to find your way around easily. It shows the whole area. I put it
in the top drawer of the chest
under the TV in your bedroom.
答案解析：这道题不少同学都会误选F。一方面是因为drawer of the chest读的比较弱，另一方面也是由于TV的干扰过于强烈。不过录音中说的是under，而非F选项中的on the top of，因此排除。
第19题答案：732281
对应原文：But if you want a takeaway, the Italian one does really good pasta and pizzas. Call
7-3 double 2-8-1
答案解析：这道题在后面设置了个中国食物的干扰项。不过迷惑性并不强，只要看准题干就好。
第20题答案：Thursday/Thursdays
对应原文：The exhibition is small but really good. It gets very crowded on Sundays, so I suggest you visit it on a quieter day, later in the week, but not on
Thursdays
which is market day you won’t find anywhere to park and it’s also the only day of the week when they’re not open!
答案解析：录音中提到了两个日期，分别为Sundays和Thursdays。前者人比较多，后者才是不开门的日子。只要守好题干中的限定条件就不算太难。

剑桥雅思9Test4Section3听力原文与答案
剑桥雅思9听力第四套题目第三部分的主题为老师和学生讨论课程反馈。内容包括女性对课程的感受，以及过去一年的活动安排等。虽然单句填空和简答题在现在雅思听力考试中并不常见，但该场景还是比较高频的。
点击查看这篇雅思听力中需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
与具体题目的
答案解析
：
雅思备考听力篇 剑9 test 4 section 3 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思9Test4听力Section3答案解析 Kira
剑桥雅思9 Test4 Section3
雅思听力
原文
PAUL: Hello, Kira, how are you?
KIRA: Fine thanks, Paul, how are you?
PAUL: Well, thanks. It’s good to see you. It must be twelve months since you did our course?
KIRA: That’s right. It’s nice to come back and say hello.
PAUL: What course did you enrol in?
KIRA: Actually, I went straight into third-year Pharmacy. They credited me with two years, which probably made it more difficult for me.
PAUL: On the other hand, you were lucky to be granted credits. Is that why you chose the course?
KIRA: Yes. And, as
I’d already finished a course in it in my country (Q21)
, I thought it would be easier if I studied something I already knew.
PAUL: I didn’t realise you went into third year. I thought you started in the first year. No wonder it was so hard! And what do you think is one of the big differences between studying at a university here and studying in your country?
KIRA: Well, I’ve found it very difficult to write assignments, because I wasn’t familiar with that aspect of the system here. The main problem is that the lecturers expect you to be critical. That made me feel really terrible. I thought “How can I possibly do it? How can I comment on someone else’s research when they probably spent five years doing it?” I think a lot of people who come from overseas countries have similar problems. But after a while, it became easier for me. People expect you to have problems with the process of reading and writing but, in fact,
it is more a question of altering your viewpoint towards academic study (Q22)
.
PAUL:  How was the content of the lectures? Was it easy for you?
KIRA: I didn’t really have many problems understanding lectures. The content was very similar to what I’d studied before.
PAUL: And what about the lecturers themselves? Are they essentially the same as lecturers in your country?
KIRA: Well actually, no. Here, they’re much easier to
approach (Q23)
. After every lecture you can go and ask them something you didn’t understand. Or you can make an appointment and talk to them about anything in the course.
PAUL: Maybe you found them different because you’re a more
mature (Q24)
student now, whereas when you were studying in your country you were younger and not so assertive.
KIRA: No, I don’t think that’s the difference. Most of the students here do it. In my faculty, they all seem to make appointments – usually to talk about something in the course that’s worrying them, but sometimes just about something that might really
interest (Q25)
them, something they might want to specialise in. The lecturers must set aside certain times every week when they’re available for students.
PAUL: That’s good to hear.
PAUL: And how was your timetable? Was it a very busy year?
KIRA: Very, very busy. They make you work very hard. Apart from lectures, we had practical sessions in a lot of subjects. We did these
in small groups (Q26)
. I had to go and work four hours every week in a community pharmacy. Actually, I enjoyed this very much – meeting new people all the time. Then in second semester, we had to get experience in hospital dispensaries, so
every second day (Q27)
we went to one of the big hospitals and worked there. And on top of all that we had our assignments, which took me a lot of time. Oh, I nearly forgot, between first and second semesters, we had to work full-time for
two weeks (Q28)
in a hospital.
PAUL: That does sound a very heavy year. So are you pleased now that you did it? Do you feel some sense of achievement?
KIRA: Yeah, I do feel
much more confident (Q29)
, which I suppose is the most important thing.
PAUL: And have you got any recommendations for people who are studying from overseas?
KIRA: Well, I suppose they need very good English. It would be much better if they spent more time learning English before they enter the university, because you can be in big trouble if you don’t understand what people are saying and you haven’t got time to translate.
PAUL: Anything else?
KIRA: Well, as I said before, the biggest problem for me was a lack of familiarity with the
education system (Q30)
here.
PAUL: It sounds as if it was a real challenge. Congratulations, Kira.
KIRA: Thanks, Paul.
剑桥雅思9 Test4 Section3雅思听力答案
21. A
22. C
23. approach
24. mature
25. interest
26. groups
27. every 2 days
28. 2 weeks
29. confident
30. education system

剑桥雅思9Test4听力Section3答案解析 Kira
剑桥雅思9听力第四套题目第三部分由2道单项选择，3道单句填空以及5道简答题构成。其中，简答题在现在雅思听力考试中出现的频率较低。差不多一年一两次。下面是具体每道题的答案解析。
点击查看这篇
雅思听力
对应的
录音原文
与其中出现的需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思9Test4Section3听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑9 test 4 section 3 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思9 Test4 Section3听力答案解析
第21题答案：A
对应原文：Yes. And, as
I’d already finished a course in it in my country
, I thought it would be easier if I studied something I already knew.
答案解析：录音中提到，Kira在自己国家已经完成过该专业的课程，由此确定A为答案。B选项错在是学校给了她两年的学分，而非在读了两年的课程，因此排除。原文中没有提到她对该课程的感受，因此C选项也排除。
第22题答案：C
对应原文：People expect you to have problems with the process of reading and writing but, in fact,
it is more a question of altering your viewpoint towards academic study
答案解析：C选项中，change与alter对应，way of thinking与viewpoint对应，由此确定答案。A选项和B选项则都完全没有提到。
第23题答案：approach
对应原文：Well actually, no. Here, they’re much easier to
approach
答案解析：听到老师提起lecturers意识到答案即将到来。空前词easier原词出现，由此确定approach为答案。
第24题答案：mature
对应原文：Maybe you found them different because you’re a more
mature
student now
答案解析：答案的定位不难，主要还是拼写比较麻烦一些。不过这本书的Test2 Section 1已经考察过一次该单词，不知道大家还有没有印象。
第25题答案：interest
对应原文：usually to talk about something in the course that’s worrying them, but sometimes just about something that might really
interest
them, something they might want to specialise in.
答案解析：听到worrying them意识到答案即将到来，根据并列关系和空后的them确定interest为答案。这里用的是interest的动词文章来自老烤鸭雅思形式，表示使…感兴趣，使…关注的意思。
第26题答案：groups
对应原文：Apart from lectures, we had practical sessions in a lot of subjects. We did these
in small groups
答案解析：听到practical sessions意识到答案即将到来。从题干中的疑问词how可以推断出空上应该填某种方式，由此确定答案为in small groups。虽然剑桥雅思后面的答案只给了groups，但在不超字数的情况下，添加修饰词并不算错。
第27题答案：every 2 days
对应原文：Then in second semester, we had to get experience in hospital dispensaries, so
every second day
答案解析：听到hospital意识到答案即将出现，题干中的how often提示我们空上应该填一个频率，由此锁定every second day。剑桥雅思书后面给的every 2 days算是答案的同义替换，两者均可。
第28题答案：2 weeks
对应原文：Oh, I nearly forgot, between first and second semesters, we had to work full-time for
two weeks
in a hospital.
答案解析：虽然how much这一提问方式稍微有些含糊不清。但full-time之后能作为答案的只有two weeks。
第29题答案：confident
对应原文：Yeah, I do feel
much more confident
, which I suppose is the most important thing.
答案解析：跟26题类似，虽然本书后面给的答案只有confident。但加上原文中much more的限定肯定是不算错的。
第30题答案：education system
对应原文：Well, as I said before, the biggest problem for me was a lack of familiarity with the
education system
here.
答案解析：一些同学可能会将前面提到的English当作答案。但题干开头说的是in addition to the language，即除了语言之外还有什么，因此排除English。题干中的familiar与录音中的familiarity词性替换，由此确定答案为education system。

剑桥雅思9Test4Section4听力原文与答案 wildlife in city gardens
剑桥雅思9听力第四套题目第四部分的主题为城市花园里的野生动物。其具体内容包括小组选择该话题的原因，获取数据的方式，要求花园主配合的内容，以及三种典型动物的情况等。难度较大。
点击查看这篇雅思听力中需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
与具体题目的
答案解析
：
雅思备考听力篇 剑9 test 4 section 4 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思9Test4听力Section4答案解析 wildlife in city gardens
剑桥雅思9 Test4 Section4
雅思听力
原文
Good morning. Today I’d like to present the findings of our Year 2 project on wildlife found in gardens throughout our city. I’ll start by saying something about the background to the project, then talk a little bit about our research techniques, and then indicate some of our interim findings.
First of all, how did we choose our topic? Well, there are four of us in the group and one day while we were discussing a possible focus,
two of the group mentioned that they had seen yet more sparrow-hawks – one of Britain’s most interesting birds of prey – in their own city centre gardens and wondered why they were turning up in these gardens in great numbers (Q31)
.
We were all very engaged by the idea of why wild animals would choose to inhabit a city garden. Why is it so popular with wildlife when the countryside itself is becoming less so?
The first thing we did was to establish what proportion of the urban land is taken up by private gardens. We estimated that it was about one fifth, and
this was endorsed by looking at large-scale usage maps in the town land survey office (Q32)
– 24% to be precise. Our own informal discussions with neighbours and friends led us to believe that many garden owners had interesting experiences to relate regarding wild animal sightings so we decided to
survey garden owners from different areas of the city. Just over 100 of them completed a survey once every two weeks for twelve months – ticking off species they
had seen from a pro form a list – and adding the names of any rarer ones
(Q33)
. Meanwhile,  we were doing our own observations in selected gardens throughout the city.
We deliberately chose smaller ones because they were by far the most typical in the city The whole point of the project was to look at the norm not the exception (Q34)
.
Alongside this primary research on urban gardens,
we were studying a lot of books about the decline of wild animals in the countryside (Q35)
and thinking of possible causes for this.
So what did we find? Well, so much that I just won’t have time to tell you about here. If you’re interested in reading our more comprehensive findings, we’ve produced detailed graphic representations on the college web-site and of course any of the group would be happy to talk to you about them. Just email us.
What we’ve decided to present today is information about just three species – because we felt these gave a good indication of the processes at work in rural and urban setting s as a whole (Q36)
.
The first species to generate a lot of interesting information was frogs (Q37)
. And there was a clear pattern here – they proliferate where there is suitable water. Garden ponds are on the increase, rural ponds are disappearing, leading to massive migration to the towns.
Hedgehogs are also finding it easier to live in urban areas – this time because
their predators are not finding it quite so attractive to leave their rural environment, so hedgehogs have a better survival rate in cities (Q38)
We had lots of sightings, so all in all
we had no difficulties with our efforts to count their numbers precisely (Q39)
.
Our final species is the finest of bird singers, the song thrush. On the decline in the countryside, they are experiencing a resurgence in urban gardens because these days gardeners are buying lots of different plants which means
there’s an extensive range of seeds around, which is what they feed on (Q40)
. Another factor is the provision of nesting places – which is actually better in gardens than the countryside. Hard to believe it, but it’s true. Incidentally, we discovered that a massive new survey on song thrushes is about to be launched, so you should keep an eye open for that.
Now, I’d be happy to answer any questions you may have …
剑桥雅思9 Test4 Section4雅思听力答案
31. C
32. A
33. B
34. B
35. A
36. C
37. frog/frogs
38. predators
39. count
40. seed/seeds

剑桥雅思9Test4听力Section4答案解析 wildlife in city gardens
剑桥雅思9听力第四套题目第四部分由6道单项选择与4道表格填空构成，几乎算得上是目前出版的剑桥雅思系列书籍中最难的Section4之一。选择题正确选项的同义替换十分复杂。而一些填空则没有明显的提示点，只能根据句义来定位。下面是具体每道题目的答案解析。
点击查看这篇
雅思听力
对应的
录音原文
与其中出现的需要大家掌握的
重点词汇
：
剑桥雅思9Test4Section4听力原文
雅思备考听力篇 剑9 test 4 section 4 雅思听力高频词汇
剑桥雅思9 Test4 Section4听力答案解析
第31题答案：C
对应原文：two of the group mentioned that they had seen yet more sparrow-hawks – one of Britain’s most interesting birds of prey – in their own city centre gardens and wondered why they were turning up in these gardens in great numbers
答案解析：选项A和选项B在录音中都没有提到。虽然选项C是正确答案，但其recent phenomenon一词所概括的内容太长（在城市中心花园中看到更多的sparrow hawks），需要较强的句义理解能力才能将两者对应起来。
第32题答案：A
对应原文：We estimated that it was about one fifth, and
this was endorsed by looking at large-scale usage maps in the town land survey office
答案解析：原文中提到，他们通过查询城镇土地调查办公室大比例的地图确认了这一数据。选项A中的official documents对应large-scale usage maps，由此确定答案。B选项中的photos属于无中生有，C选项中的surveyors则是在替换过程中文章来自老烤鸭雅思出现了意思偏差，因此统统排除。
第33题答案：B
对应原文：so we decided to survey garden owners from different areas of the city. Just over 100 of them completed a survey once every two weeks for twelve months – ticking off species they had seen from a pro form a list – and adding the names of any rarer ones
答案解析：录音中提到他们要求花园所有者在12个月的时间里，每两周完成一次调查。划掉他们看到的物种，加上任何稀有物种的名字。即记录所看到的动物。这道题的难点跟第31题一样，都是正确选项的概括太过简略，不像是我们平时所熟悉的词汇或短语的同义替换。
第34题答案：B
对应原文：We deliberately chose smaller ones because they were by far the most typical in the city. The whole point of the project was to look at the norm not the exception
答案解析：这道题要相对简单一些，只要能够抓住typical和representative的同义替换，即可确定B为答案。
第35题答案：A
对应原文：Alongside this primary research on urban gardens,
we were studying a lot of books about the decline of wild animals in the countryside
and thinking of possible causes for this.
答案解析：这道题进行了大量的同义替换。先是将题干中的extensive reading替换为a lot of books，然后又将animals替换成wildlife，countryside替换成rurual areas，由此确定A为答案。
第36题答案：C
对应原文：What we’ve decided to resent today is information about just three species – because we felt these gave a good indication of the processes at work in rural and urban settings as a whole
答案解析：这道题要稍微简单一些，好歹有个because的提示。indicate与indication词性替换，as a whole则对应general trends，由此确定C为答案。而无论是A选项的a lot of data，还是B选项的most interest，在原文中都找不到对应点。
第37题答案：frog/frogs
对应原文：The first species to generate a lot of interesting information was
frogs
答案解析：从表头可以推断出空上应该填一种生物。first species有一定的提示作用，帮助我们确定后面的frogs为答案。不过因为这道题离上一道题距离太近，给我们增加了额外的困难。
第38题答案：predators
对应原文：Hedgehogs are also finding it easier to live in urban areas – this time because their
predators
are not finding it quite so attractive to leave their rural environment, so hedgehogs have a better survival rate in cities
答案解析：听到Hedgehogs意识到答案即将到来，原文对safer进行了词义解释，找不到直接的对应词，只能通过词性和句义来判断答案。
第39题答案：count
对应原文：We had lots of sightings, so all in all we had no difficulties with our efforts to
count
their numbers precisely
答案解析：空前词easy被替换成no difficulties，从题干可以推测空上应该填一个动词，由此确定答案为count。
第40题答案：seed/seeds
对应原文：they are experiencing a resurgence in urban gardens because these days gardeners are buying lots of different plants which means there’s an extensive range of
seeds
around, which is what they feed on
答案解析：不少同学会根据空前的a variety of将plants当作答案。但它并不符合空后to eat这一信息点。an extensive range of与a variety of同义替换，feed on与eat同义替换，由此舍弃plants，锁定seeds为答案。
